Title: About the fried enemy tank and the capture of the Russian commander: the war of Kombat Olefirenka
Description: The major of the Armed Forces of Ukraine told the correspondent about episodes of combat work of tankers in a large-scale war, as well as about the preparation of the unit ArmyInform . Artur Olefirenko currently commands the 1st tank battalion of the separate Siver tank brigade. He started his military career back in 2014. Then he served as a mechanic-driver and fought against the Russians near Luhansk. Later, he decided to become an officer and entered the National Academy of Land Forces named after Hetman Peter Sahaidachny. In 2019, after graduating from university, I took the position of tank platoon commander in the 1st separate tank Siver brigade. - All my service - from platoon commander to battalion commander - I have served in the First Tank and this I'm proud! - says Artur Olefirenko. At the beginning of the large-scale Russian invasion of Ukraine, Artur Olefirenko commanded a tank company. They were on the border with Belarus. But later they received an order to retreat to Chernigov and take up defense there. The first tank defended the city together with the 58th brigade named after Hetman Vyhovsky, which fought on the approaches to Chernihiv. At that time, Artur Olefirenka had a group of four T-64BV tanks. I had to work almost around the clock. Huge convoys of Russian vehicles and the practice of tankers against the enemy were remembered. In one of the battles, Artur destroyed a Russian T-72B tank, as well as an enemy BMP. The infantry fighting vehicle burned down along with the crew and landing party. And the crew of the tank was captured. In this tank was the commander of tank battalion 35 of the separate Guards Motorized Rifle Brigade of the Russian Federation, Major Leonid Shchotkin. Schotkin's crew managed to distinguish themselves by shelling a residential building in Chernihiv, for which the Russian major was later sentenced to 11 years in prison. — After the loss of command, the fighting spirit of the Russians disappeared somewhere, and the offensive was stopped, - recalls Artur Olefirenko. For the defense of Chernihiv at that time, Captain Artur Olefirenko was the commander of the 8th tank company of the 3rd tank battalion - received the award -Honorary Citizen of the City of Chernihiv- and the Order of Bohdan Khmelnytsky III degree. After the battles for Chernihiv, the company underwent reconstruction and received Bulat tanks. And again into battle. They fought in almost all areas of the front — near Kharkiv, in the Donetsk, Luhansk and Zaporizhzhia regions. — The battles for Lysychansk and Lyman are the most memorable. Then we worked together with paratroopers of the 25th and 81st brigades. There, the company shot down a large amount of Russian equipment — Russian BMP-2s and tanks were on fire, Artur Olefirenko recalls. In 2024, he took command of a tank battalion. - As for a commander, the main thing for me is the motivation of the personnel. So that the tankers understood each other with half a word, so that they were friendly. Our battalion is a big military family. Senior soldiers train the new arrivals, they are helped in this by the battalion management. And we give 100%. It happens that newcomers don't do everything right away, but over time they make up for it, - says Artur Olefirenko. According to him, many soldiers of the battalion who were in battles were awarded both departmental honors and state awards. Replenishment takes place both at the expense of training centers, and they themselves periodically select tankers. In any case, all newcomers undergo training even in the unit itself. - For us, the main thing is to expel the enemy from our Ukraine and for our children to grow up without war, - adds Artur Olefirenko. Photo of the author and 1 separate tank brigade of Siversk

Title: Stalker goes to sea: US shipbuilders presented an unmanned surface ship
Description: As stated on the portal of the American manufacturer, Swift Sea-Stalker The S3 is an unmanned (remote or autonomous) small unmanned surface vehicle (sUSV) with high endurance, a strong aluminum hull and a super-powerful diesel engine, according to ArmyInform. Designed for surveillance and interception missions, the S3 USV is designed to operate in difficult waterways in conflict zones, including the Gulf of Africa and South China Sea regions. The S3 can be operated remotely or operate autonomously, providing flexibility and efficiency in maritime operations. Equipped with four AGM-179 Air-to-Ground Missiles (JAGMs) combined in one installation, this maritime drone represents a significant advance in the US Navy's unmanned maritime capabilities. The maritime drone has a top speed of more than 56 km/h, an effective range of 1,000 nautical miles, and the ability to continuously perform tasks for about 40 hours, ensuring long-term operational capabilities. These features enable it to effectively monitor and respond to threats along its coastlines, increasing security at sea. The Yanmar 4LV230 230hp (3800RPM) engine provided for this craft is available in two different powerplants: propeller driven and jet powered. It complies with NATO standardization agreements (STANAG) 4586 and the protocol of the common architecture of unmanned aerial vehicles systems (JAUS). The Marine UAV is capable of carrying a maximum payload of 1,500 pounds (680 kg). For control, the Swift Sea-Stalker S3 drone is equipped with radar/EO/GPS/AIS/ and COTS sensors. Swiftships recently received a contract from the Pentagon to manufacture the S3 USV. -We are proud to support the US Department of Defense's mission to protect its waters and protect vital maritime interests,- Swiftships said. -The delivery of the S3 USV is a significant step forward in achieving future maritime security goals.-

Title: The F-16 is invincible in air combat, but there was one exception
Description: ArmyInform tells about which plane was able to confirm the downing of an F-16 during a real aerial battle. The circumstances of the incident were reconstructed, so the dogfight can be viewed on video. Reconstruction of air battle between Greek and Turkish fighter jets The battle took place on October 8, 1996 in the context of the Aegean dispute - a conflict between Greece and Turkey over sovereignty and adjacent rights in the Aegean Sea and airspace spaces above it. Read also: F-16s were in Ukraine long before August 2024: Americans piloted together with Ukrainians However, for a long time none of the parties officially recognized the fact, and only more than one and a half ten years later, Turkey acknowledged the loss of one of its F-16s as a result of a Greek fighter jet being shot down by a missile. On the other hand, Greece has never officially acknowledged the downing of an F-16 fighter of the Turkish Air Force. It is known from open sources that the incident occurred during the Greek-Cypriot -Nikiphoros- exercises and the simultaneous exercises of the Turkish Air Force. It is reasonable to assume that the exercises were deliberately conducted simultaneously to disrupt the armed forces of a neighboring country. Read also: How the F-16 shot down the Russian -Sushka-: about the historic battle and why Kursk is here During the Turkish exercises, four F4 Phantom bombers moved to the southwest in the area between the islands Chios and Samos of the Aegean Sea. The bombers were accompanied by a pair of F-16 fighters. When the Greek military saw Turkish planes on radar, they raised a pair of fighter jets to identify and intercept the identified targets. Ultimately, this led to the downing of one of the Turkish F-16s. Read also: Two F-16s collide during simulated combat, one pilot survives: from NATO history When a pair of Hellas fighters went out to intercept, one of the Turkish F-16s, according to some claims , entered Greek airspace in the area of ​​the island of Chios. One of the Greek pilots immediately attacked, firing an R550 Magic II -Mazhik- missile at the intruder. The Magic R.550 is a close-range air-to-air missile from the French company Matra. It was developed in 1965 to compete with the American AIM-9 Sidewinder missile. Read also: F-16 -stormed- so fast that slow electronics couldn't cope: test video explains everything Magic R.550 made compatible with Sidewinder launch equipment, so it could be launched, in particular, from F-16 fighters. However, this time the missile was launched by another air fighter. It was as French as the missile, the Dassault Mirage 2000, a fourth-generation multirole jet fighter. Developed in the 1970s by Dassault Aviation, it became the main combat aircraft of the French Air Force in the late 20th and early 21st centuries. Read also: Accidentally flew into the air. The incident that could put an end to the F-16 project Greece purchased from France and put the Mirage 2000 into service in the late 1980s, so by the mid-1990s Greek pilots already had many years of experience operating these fighters. After the defeat, one of the Turkish pilots died, but the second was able to eject successfully. Later, he was picked up by Greek rescuers. In Turkey, the fact of the loss of an F-16 fighter as a result of a battle with a Greek Mirage 2000 was recognized only in 2012. This was done by Turkish Defense Minister Ismet Yilmaz. In response to a parliamentary inquiry, a Turkish official said that on October 8, 1996, a Turkish F-16D Block 40 was shot down by a Greek Mirage 2000 using an R.550 Magic II missile. Despite the fact that Greece did not recognize the fact that the F-16 was shot down by a Mirage 2000 missile, in Turkey, the relatives of the dead F-16 pilot sued the Greek officer who piloted the Mirage 2000. This caused one of the many exacerbations in Greek-Turkish relations, about which was written with indignation in the media of both countries. The French began promoting their Mirage 2000 fighter as -the only plane that can shoot down an F-16.- Earlier, ArmyInform reported that France will provide Ukraine with Mirage 2000 aircraft and provide staffing of the Ukrainian army brigade.

Title: Battle for Pokrovsk: about fortifications, enemy losses and what does the weather have to do with it
Description: What are the possible scenarios of the development of events in this direction and will the Ukrainian defenders be able to crush the offensive potential of the occupiers? Military expert Petro Chernyk told ArmyInform about this. — Is the task before the Russians to seize the Pokrovskoe-Myronograd agglomeration in a strategic sense? Of course, there is such a task. Why? This is the next link in the strategy that they are considering - access to the administrative borders of Donetsk region and Luhansk region. Indeed, they are somewhere within 10 kilometers of Pokrovsk. In fact, the enemy already has full-fledged barrel artillery there. Let's say the D-30 howitzer has a strike range of 15 kilometers, while their longest-range systems such as Hyacinth, Msta B, Acacia work at 28 kilometers. Yes, indeed, heavy artillery duels are already taking place on this part of the front. — But there are several important nuances. Let's recall Bakhmut. The active phase of the Battle of Bakhmut is 10 months. That's a lot. One PVK -Wagner- lost about 22 thousand killed there. If, relatively speaking, the battle begins in September-October, it will be long-lasting, heavy and bloody for the occupiers. Why? The so-called wet weather season is approaching, rains are expected in autumn. The enemy will not be able to use heavy tracked vehicles, such as tanks, BMP from flanking positions, from the field. There will be only large infantry ramparts. And large infantry ramparts are very, very difficult even for Rashist infantry to move on a wet field. Also, mining the terrain on our side. This is all they have to go through. The expert adds that the same reasoning applies to Avdiivka. Avdiivka was stormed by the Russians for almost 10 years, starting in 2014, just as the war in Donbas began. And this year alone, the active phase of fighting for this Ukrainian city lasted more than four months. During this period alone, the Russian army lost almost 50,000 soldiers. Petro Chernyk emphasizes that battles can be lost. Even if we have to leave Pokrovsk, it will not be a disaster. — I really like historical parallels. The Battle of Poitiers is one of the greatest victories of the English in the Hundred Years' War, which was won in 1356 over the French. Then the English captured the French king, but in the end, England just lost the war. And there is one more nuance. The enemy now has a huge personnel problem. He is able to mobilize up to 30-32 thousand per month, but he can't do more at the moment. During this summer alone, the Defense Forces of Ukraine destroyed more than 107,000 Russians. And here, as I call it, the pre-emptive extermination of even 2-3 thousand enemy personnel is a very important and principled issue. I do not cancel the battle for Pokrovsk. It (this battle. - Ed.) is extremely important, but I don't think it will be an easy walk for the occupiers. Perhaps the battle for the Pokrov-Myrnograd agglomeration will be the battle that will ultimately undermine the combat potential of Russian troops. How the Germans once undermined their strategic offensive potential during the ten-month standoff with the French at Verdun in 1916. Of course, time will tell. — In the spring, the government allocated more than 20 billion hryvnias for the construction of fortifications of defense lines. Defense lines continue to be built near Pokrovsk and Myrnohrad. The expert adds that -this is a continuous process.- Of course, the construction of fortifications, with problems, with human factors, mistakes and the like, is not without this, but they are still being built. And the enemy will have to reckon with it. — In addition, the process of saturating the units of the Defense Forces with weapons is currently underway. Chernyk says, at the beginning of the Great War, the Americans produced 14,000 shells of 155 caliber per month. And now they have already confirmed that now, for the fall, they reached the figure of 50 thousand shells. This is a very good step forward. Also, the Czech armed initiative to help Ukraine was fully operational. — Recall that at the beginning of the large-scale invasion, the ratio of artillery volleys was 1 to 10, 1 to 15, and sometimes 1 to 20. Now even the Russians say that there are moments and locations when we (Ukrainian Defense Forces . — Ed.) in parity, and sometimes there are more artillery volleys than they have.

Title: They were scared by a drone, shot with a machine gun - a trap for the enemy from our fighters
Description: The video appeared on September 18 on the group's channel. The assault group of Russians hid in a barn. Our FPV drone flew there. After the explosion, those Russians who could walk ran away. Two invaders ran right at our machine gun and were shot at close range. As reported by ArmyInform, the pilots of Tactical Group -Adam- made a selection destruction of Russian attack aircraft that never reached our positions.

Title: The Russians use UAVs for delivery in the Kharkiv Region: the Armed Forces oppose
Description: Vitaliy Sarantsev, the spokesman of OTU -Kharkiv-, told about this on the air of the nationwide telethon -Edyny Novyni- . — The opponent is trying to apply it. In particular, this was also the case in Vovchansk, when with the help of drones they deliver provisions and ammunition to blocked servicemen on the territory of the Aggregate Plant. They also tried to provide those units that perform tasks near Lyptsi or Lukyantsi, he said. The spokesman explained that these are mostly UAVs capable of carrying a certain load weighing up to several kilograms. Thus, the enemy is trying to carry out logistical support measures, that is, to deliver water, provisions, and ammunition. -However, it is going very badly for him, at least in the direction of Hlyboky-Lyptsy, because there we have strengthened certain measures and, in connection with this, logistical support of the enemy's forward positions is almost not happening,- the spokesman said. He noted that he will not reveal all the secrets live, but noted that the Defense Forces are effectively countering the enemy in this regard. At the same time, the occupiers intensified aerial reconnaissance with the aim of finding new supply routes, places of possible basing and setting up positions, as well as identifying units of the Defense Forces and subsequently inflicting fire damage on them. — As for the location and the direction of Liptsi-Hlyboke, we notice a certain lull in the enemy's activity there, but this does not mean that he has abandoned his intentions. He is strengthening there, he is carrying out fortification equipment for his positions, he is bringing in additional personnel there, - Vitaly Sarantsev said. This means that the enemy has not given up its aggressive intentions and plans to resume offensive actions. — The most difficult situation remains in Vovchansk itself, where fighting is constantly going on where the enemy is trying to advance in different areas of the city. In particular, in the areas of high-rise buildings, he is trying to carry out assaults in some places with the support of light armored vehicles. However, he does not manage to do all this, said the spokesman of Kharkiv OTU. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that in the Vovchan direction, the occupiers increased the number of reconnaissance drone flights, increasing air reconnaissance by about 40% compared to the previous period.

Title: They pushed through the channel, got to the other world - the destruction of the enemy near the Chas...
Description: The video of the fight appeared on September 18 on the brigade channel. But the assault of the Russians ended before it had even begun. First, the enemy was hit by FPV drones and drops. Those who remained alive tried to escape, but in vain. One of the invaders decided to pretend to be dead, but our drones did not believe him. Then the Russian -helped- himself with early demobilization with his own machine gun. As reported by ArmyInform, fighters of the 24th mechanized brigade named after King Danylo filmed the remains of Chasovoy Yar, which the Russians continue to storm and erase from the face of the earth with all possible types of weapons: artillery, mines, rockets, kamikaze drones and anti-tank missiles.

Title: Mines are dropped from drones: the Armed Forces explained why the Russians mine the area in the Khar...
Description: Does this indicate the enemy's refusal of offensive operations on the air of the nationwide telethon -Edyny Novyny- explained the spokesman of OTU -Kharkiv- Vitaly Sarantsev. — They are not mining a continuous territory, but are conducting reconnaissance of possible routes for the advancement of our forces, and on these possible routes they are dropping mines. They are dropping a PFM-1 mine, the so-called Petal, he said. Recently, the fighters of the units of the Defense Forces also discovered new anti-personnel mines, which were probably made in an artisanal way. - Recently, it was noticed that they are trying to use a new type of ammunition - a mine, the body of which is made on a 3D printer. It is made of plastic, that is, it does not have increased electromagnetic sensitivity. Inside it is filled with TNT, has a detonator, the spokesman said. It is precisely such mines that the Russian occupiers scatter on the routes of the possible advance of units of the Defense Forces. — This is done with the help of UAVs. I won't say it's a systemic thing, but it means the opponent needs more time to prepare for a counterattack. In this way, they are trying to restrain the possible advance of units of the Defense Forces, Vitaly Sarantsev explained. At the same time, he emphasized that the Russian occupiers have not given up their aggressive intentions. They move and accumulate personnel, reform and reformat assault groups, attempt to establish a system of command, communication and supply in order to build up forces and resume offensive operations. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that occupiers began to scatter anti-personnel mines of a new type in the north of Kharkiv region, which in principle, the actions are similar to the prohibited PFM-1 -Petal- mine.

Title: Our stormtroopers teleported two occupants to the Kobzon concert

But our drone operators did not believe this performance and hit it with an FPV drone. When the smoke after the heavy smoke cleared, it turned out that there were no bodies of the occupiers left at the site of the explosion. The pilots had to search for their remains in the bushes. As reported by ArmyInform, the pilots of the 1st Assault Battalion of the 92nd Assault Brigade named after Kosh Ataman Ivan Sirk spotted and hit a pile of enemy ammunition stacked in the open air, or rather, under a tree.

Title: Fake chatbots mimic the Chief Intelligence bot
Description: The Main Intelligence Directorate of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine informed about this on September 18. -The enemy is trying to mislead Ukrainians living in the temporarily occupied territories by creating bots that, by their description, name and visuals, reproduce the official chatbot of the GUR -Main Intelligence Bot-, the message says. It is dangerous to transmit any information through such bots. GUR reminds that the official chatbot of the Main Directorate of Intelligence is located at the following link: https://t.me/gur_official_bot. Also, a link to the current bot can always be found on the Main Intelligence Bot page on the GUR website and on the official pages of GUR on social networks. Such pages are marked with a blue or green tick. People can safely and anonymously contact GUR in the following ways: As reported by ArmyInform, Russians are also not far away try to accuse the Armed Forces of Ukraine of looting and war crimes in Kurshchyna.

Title: Arrived, shot, left - our tank attacked in Donetsk region

Title: Transferred -to foot feed-: in Kharkiv Oblast, the occupiers poisoned themselves due to a lack of pr...
Description: The reasons for the mass poisoning of the Russian occupiers on the air of the national telethon -Edyni Novyni- explained the spokesman of OTU -Kharkiv- Vitaly Sarantsev. — The reasons are quite simple. For several days, the personnel of the enemy, who are in the forward positions, will not receive either provisions or water. Because of this, he is forced to switch to foot feed, he said. Forced to feed themselves, the occupiers often consume poor-quality water and food. - He is forced to drink water from streams or from wells. Earlier, we reported that in some places the enemy does not take away their dead, due to which there is a complication of the sanitary-epidemiological situation, the spokesman explained. So the situation is complicated by the fact that in some places the enemy does not evacuate irreversible losses, so the bodies of the dead Russian soldiers decompose and poison the area. — A certain amount of something gets into the ground, into the water. This is all the enemy is trying to consume. This leads to the fact that the personnel who drank or used this water, where there are other needs, develop gastrointestinal disorders. There are no corresponding medicines either. This worsens, in addition to everything else, the enemy's morale, which is why we note cases of more frequent surrenders, - said Vitaly Sarantsev. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that massed stomach disorder knocked off the feet of the occupiers in Kharkiv Oblast and that zdavatysya-v-polon/->logistics -in manual mode- forces the Russian invaders to surrender as prisoners.

Title: An analogue of the forbidden -Lepestka-: the occupiers are installing new mines in Kharkiv Oblast
Description: This was notified in Kharkiv OTU. These are pressure mines that have a body printed on a 3D printer. Inside the case is a detonator and a plastid charge. -In terms of size and principle of action, the new mines are similar to the PFM-1 -Petal- mine banned by international conventions. Their small size and unpredictable nature make them extremely insidious,- Kharkiv OTU emphasized. There are currently no reliable data on the scalability of the production of these mines in the Russian Federation. It can be assumed that the appearance of such mines may be the result of the private initiative of individual manufacturers. Despite the relative ease of making such mines, they pose a serious threat to the lives of our defenders. In connection with the new danger in the -Kharkiv- OTU, they called for increased caution in the combat zones and in the liberated territories. Earlier, ArmiyaInform reported that the Armed Forces of Ukraine explained why are Russian inhumans executing Ukrainian prisoners.

Title: From raising children to aiding the occupiers: a kindergarten worker was convicted in Kharkiv
Description: This was notified in the Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office. An employee of one of the Kharkiv kindergartens has been an active participant in pro-Russian chats in the Telegram messenger since September 2023. There, the woman wrote comments in which she denied the armed aggression of the Russian Federation and discredited the defenders of our state, claiming that they are the ones who strike the civilian infrastructure of the regional center. In addition, while communicating with an acquaintance who lives in the Russian Federation, the woman gave him information about the locations of the Ukrainian military on the territory of Kharkiv. This information was not published in open access. Law enforcement officers exposed the woman at the end of March this year at her place of residence and seized evidence of her illegal activities. The accused was awaiting trial while in custody. During the trial, she fully admitted her guilt and repented of what she had done. The court found the woman guilty of disseminating information about the location of military formations formed in accordance with the laws of Ukraine, committed under martial law, as well as manufacturing and disseminating materials that contain denials of armed aggression by the Russian Federation against Ukraine. The court sentenced the woman to 5 years in prison. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that a Russian policeman and his Ukrainian posipaka will be tried in Kharkiv Oblast for that during the occupation they tortured Ukraine's defender.

Title: There is a very important result for last night on the territory of Russia — the President
Description: The President stated this in appeals of September 18. -There is a very important result for last night on the territory of Russia. These are the things that weaken the enemy. I thank everyone involved! Such aptness that inspires! Our special services: Security Service, GUR, Special Operations Forces thank you!- said Volodymyr Zelenskyi. According to him, today there were two reports of the Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, General Oleksandr Syrskyi. -At first, there was a long report about all directions of our actions, our defense, our offensive steps. General Syrsky reported on the changes in the situation in the Kursk region, and our reaction to it. Strong reaction. Every one of our divisions is well done there. We will keep the situation on our bridgehead within the limits of calculations,- the President noted. According to him, maximum attention is also paid to directions in Kharkiv region and Donetsk region. -We are working on strengthening, and this is in terms of weapons and personnel. Today, I spoke with the Minister of Finance of Ukraine and the Secretary of the National Security Council regarding funds for key state needs, for defense. We have to provide everything that Ukraine needs,- said Volodymyr Zelenskyi. According to him, the priority is not only to implement everything that has already been agreed upon and that is currently stalled at the logistics stage, but also more strategic things. -We have clear tasks for the selection of teams: this is equipment, this is training. All the promises regarding air defense, which were made during the summit in Washington, have not yet been fully fulfilled. And it is important right now, right at the beginning of autumn, to have more results for the air shield,- the President noted. As reported by ArmyInform, The President said that the course of the war depends on the speed of implementation of agreements with partners.

Title: -Cheetah- is faster than -moped- — shooting down Iranian UAVs with German weapons
Description: The video of combat work appeared on the evening of September 18. After the first shelling, the Shahed was able to continue its flight, but after the second hit, it exploded in the air. The burning wreckage spectacularly fell not far from the position of the anti-aircraft guns. Title: The authors of the gun convoys with explosives: traitors from Luhansk region will be sentenced in ab...
Description: This was notified by the Security Service of Ukraine. There, they collected the evidence base for three more collaborators who cooperate with the Russian Federation on the temporarily captured part of the territory of Luhansk region. We are talking about Yevgeny Katsavalov, the head of the occupation administration of the -MNS LNR- and his two -deputies- - Vitaly Kucherov and Roman Kochetov. After their appointment to -positions- in 2023, the individuals involved began to follow the instructions of the Kremlin regarding the logistical support of the occupation groups of the Russian Federation fighting on the eastern front. In particular, they organized the transfer of combat FPV drones from Russia to the occupiers on the front lines. To disguise military routes, the collaborators carried out the transportation of UAVs by trucks under the guise of -humanitarian aid- for the civilian population of the frontline areas. At the same time, enemy accomplices transported ammunition and military ammunition to the Russian troops in such -gumconvoys-. -In addition, the collaborators organized the production of explosive devices for drones, which the Rashists use to attack advanced units of the Defense Forces of Ukraine. Collaborators often -report- about this during speeches on the airs of rosZMI, where they also call on the civilian population of the temporarily occupied areas of Luhansk region to support the war against Ukraine. For his cooperation, Putin awarded Katsavalov the rank of -Lieutenant General of the Internal Service- by decree, the SBU said. On the basis of the received evidence, the investigators of the Security Service informed all three collaborators in absentia about the suspicion under Part 5 of Art. 111-1 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (voluntary occupation by a citizen of Ukraine of a position related to the performance of organizational-administrative or administrative-economic functions in illegal authorities created in the temporarily occupied territory, including in the occupation administration of the aggressor state). Comprehensive measures are underway to bring perpetrators to justice for crimes against our state. As reported ArmyInform, the Security Service detained another FSB agent in Donetsk region. He was preparing a series of airstrikes by the Russian Federation against the locations of Ukrainian troops on one of the hottest areas of the front — Pokrovsky.

Title: He didn't close the hatch — he got a drone. The magical destruction of a Russian tank in Russia
Description: The video appeared on September 18 on the unit's channel. The Russian armored vehicle was in a great hurry somewhere, but did not escape from our FPV drone, which flew into the open hatch. The subsequent detonation of the ammunition turned out to be very bright. -This lousy BMD-2 went out to prevent the Cossacks from liberating Kurshchyna. The boys in panties forgot to close the door and caught the drone in the act,- Requiem group commented on the video. As reported by ArmyInform, operators of the Requiem group unit of the Special Operations Forces of the Armed Forces destroyed several units of Russian engineering equipment that were trying to restore the dilapidated bridge over the Seim in Kurshchyna.

Title: How electronic reports work — the Ministry of Defense introduces examples

Every day, Oleksandr Popov, the brigade commander, signs about 40 reports to SEDO sent by military personnel from their Army+ applications. The video describes how the Army+ application works in the Armed Forces brigade and the entire process of passing an electronic report from a serviceman through a formation to the commander: As reported by ArmyInform, the scaling of the Army+ application goes at a rapid pace — there are already 5,000 fully prepared electronic reports.

Title: A new food supply model for the Armed Forces: what is known
Description: The Ministry of Defense of Ukraine informed about this on September 18. The principle and goal of the new model is to reduce logistics in delivery and increase quality control. The MOU studied the practice of partners from Great Britain and involved expert opinions from other NATO agencies, the USA and Canada in order to implement the best practices in the Ukrainian model. -We are introducing a two-tier quality control system. The additional stage is at the distribution centers,- said the Deputy Minister of Defense. According to him, representatives of the DOT, the Ministry of Defense and suppliers check the quality of products. Only after that they are sent to military units. -For the first time, the State operator of the rear will select producers of 75% of the catalog food product through so-called signal tenders on the Prozorro system. That is, those products that are most often used are ordered by military units,- Dmytro Klimenkov said. According to him, these are meat, fish, canned goods, cereals, dairy products, etc. Suppliers will sign contracts with manufacturers. -DOT-Chain will implement a so-called black list, where suppliers who do not properly fulfill their contractual obligations will be noted,- he added. This model will be launched as a pilot project from February 2025 and will operate within a year in Kyiv, Vinnytsia, as well as in Zhytomyr, Cherkasy, Kyiv and Kirovohrad regions. No additional funds are required for this pilot project. It will be implemented exclusively with the money provided for the purchase of food products for the Armed Forces of Ukraine. One of the goals of this model is transparent reporting. Each stage of the procurement and supply process will be recorded in an electronic system. All processes and responsibilities of each party will be written there: from the customer to the contractor, from the application to the fact of delivery. -This will allow, first of all, to monitor and quickly respond to challenges and problems. The second is that it will contribute to the prevention of corruption, it will increase the responsibility of each party, and most importantly, we will receive information, analytics on the volumes and terms of supply,- Dmytro Klimenkov explained. As reported by ArmyInform, DOT-Chain is a unique digital system for managing food supply processes for the army. The system shortens the product supply cycle by 4 times and improves quality control.

Title: Burn in 30 minutes - the drone-dragon cleared another Kursk landing
Description: The video appeared on September 18 on the unit's channel. -In war, the one who is faster, more maneuverable and more flexible in his actions when completing tasks gets an advantage. Even yesterday, in order to clear and occupy the landing, we needed several days, and today, thanks to the use of such weapons as in the video, it took only 30 minutes, and the enemy was already fleeing from the landing, leaving his points and trying to hide elsewhere. And then our night bomber drone pilots were engaged in hunting,- the Pentagon commented on the video. v As reported by ArmyInform, fighters of the Pentagon unit 225 separate assault battalion discovered and destroyed an enemy transport that was trying to deliver ammunition to the positions of the Russian invaders.

Title: Mobilization hotline: more than 2 hundred calls per week
Description: The work of the hotline was told in the Telegram channel of the Ground Forces. According to the Command of the Ground Forces, thanks to this initiative, citizens can receive consultations about their rights and obligations in the process of mobilization, as well as learn about current changes in legislation. This greatly simplifies the process of interaction between the military and citizens under martial law. During the week of work (from September 9 to 15), specialists of the hotline for mobilization and registration of conscripts, as well as the call center of the Ground Forces Command processed 246 appeals from citizens. Most of them related to mobilization and were resolved over the phone. Also: – did not apply to the work of TCC and JV – 46; – forwarded to the National Police – 1; – needed additional processing – 13; With your questions, it is recommended to contact the following phones: 0 (800) 500 410 (general questions) 0 (800) 301 937 (issues of assembly, work of TCC and SP). As reported by ArmyInform, the audience the Reserve+ application has almost 3.5 million users.

Title: The Ministry of Education and Culture explained what kind of food system operates in the Armed Force...
Description: The Ministry of Defense of Ukraine informed about this on September 18. -We have completed the first stage of procurement reform for the Armed Forces. At the Ministry of Defence, we have left the rule-making. We have outsourced the procurement function to a professional agency, in this case the state rear operator,- he said. According to him, today employees of the State rear operator conduct bidding in the Prozorro system, sign contracts with suppliers on a regional basis. -Earlier, food products, let's say, moved together with the movement of a military unit from one region to another region, which complicated logistics. -Today, the supplier is responsible only for its region and for those military units that are there now and that are arriving there,- said the Deputy Minister of Defense. Earlier, ArmiyaInform reported that by order of the leadership of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine perevirku/->inspection of the food service organization system for military personnel in the northern, eastern and southern directions is in progress.

Title: A swindler who cheated money from the relatives of the fallen defenders was arrested
Description: The National Police of Ukraine reported this on September 18. According to the data, the suspect entered into the trust of the relatives of the fallen servicemen and illegally received money from the victims under the guise of donations to the Armed Forces. The policemen, with the force support of KORD special forces, detained the organizer of the fraudulent scheme while receiving UAH 300,000 from the mother of the deceased soldier. As reported by ArmyInform, fraudsters ask for data from close prisoners of war and missing persons.

Title: In Bukovyna, the organizers of two channels for transporting evaders abroad were detained

For his part, the master sergeant for $6,000 instructed his -client- on the procedure for crossing the state border, gave him appropriate advice and instructions, and later found a driver who was supposed to take the latter to the border. Title: The enemy has already attacked our positions more than a hundred times - the General Staff of the Ar...
Description: Operational information as of 16:00 on September 18 was published by the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Today, the communities of Mykolaivka, Velyka Pisarivka, Boyaro-Lezhachi, Timofiivka, Malushyna, Ugroydy, Pavlivka, Tymonovychy and Chaikine were affected by enemy artillery and mortar fire in Kharkiv Oblast, Chernihiv Oblast, and Sumy Oblast. In addition, the Russians carried out airstrikes with anti-aircraft missiles in the areas of Grafskyi, Bondarivshchyna, Malushyny, Sosnivka, Iskrivshchyna, Obodiv, and Kostyantynivka. In the Kharkiv direction, the enemy, with the support of aviation, is trying to storm the positions of our units in the Vovchansk area. In the Kupyansk direction, the Russian occupiers attacked the Defense Forces nine times in the areas of Sinkivka, Kruglyakivka, and Stelmakhivka. Two clashes are still ongoing. Ukrainian soldiers steadfastly hold the defense and inflict losses on the enemy. In the Lymansky direction, the invading army launched seven attacks on Ukrainian positions in the vicinity of Druzhelyubivka, Cherneshchyna, Nevsky, and Makiivka during the day. Twenty-three attempts by the occupiers to advance have already been repulsed. In the Vremivsk direction, there were five enemy attacks near Katerynivka and Bogoyavlenka. Three battles are not over yet. In the Gulyaipol direction, the Russian invaders attacked in vain in the Gulyaipol area. At the same time, the enemy aircraft attacked Pyatikhatki and Zherebyanki with unguided air missiles. In the Orihiv direction, the occupying forces stormed the positions of the Defense Forces in the areas of Mala Tokmachka and Novodanilivka four times. One battle is still going on. The enemy also attacked our defenders in the Dnieper direction in vain four times. The operation is ongoing in the Kursk region. Enemy aviation continues to raze their villages and cities to the ground. Title: Posipaka and the police tortured the defender of Ukraine: the torturers will be tried
Description: This was reported by the Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office. A police officer of the 2nd operational department of the 2nd operational platoon of the 2nd operational company of OMON -Zyryanin- of the Rosguard Department of the Komi Republic met a local pro-Russian resident of the Kupyan district in order to gather information about pro-Ukrainian local residents. The accomplice of the occupiers was willing to voluntarily inform the occupiers because it was in line with his political beliefs. At the end of March 2022, both men, together with other occupants, broke into a house in the village of Hryanivikka, Kup'yansky district, where a former ATO participant lived with his wife. A Russian guard beat the owner on the head with the butt of a machine gun and threatened to shoot him and his wife if they resisted. While he was beating the victim, a resident of Kupyan region was robbing. A volunteer -helper- of the Russian invaders even tore off a gold chain from the victim's neck. Later, the torturers put a bag on the victim's head and took him to the torture chamber, which was set up in the basement of a rural hotel in Hrushivka. There they beat the man with a wooden stick, a rubber baton and a metal pipe. There were inhumane conditions in the torture chamber: the victim was starved, not given drinking water and deprived of the opportunity to go to the toilet. The man was subjected to constant physical and psychological abuse. Before conducting -interrogations-, the occupiers stripped him down to his underwear and tied him up. The attackers demanded from the man to confess to cooperation with the Armed Forces of Ukraine and to -hand over- the location of the Ukrainian military. They did not receive any response from the detainee and later released the victim. Both defendants are accused of violating the laws and customs of war, committed by a group of persons based on a prior conspiracy. In addition, the resident of Kupyan region is additionally accused of treason committed under martial law. An accomplice of the Russian occupiers and a Russian riot police officer will be tried in person, as they are wanted. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that before the court a Kharkiv -blogger- who popularized the ideas of -great Russia- and the Soviet Union will appear.

Title: Reliable and maintainable in the field: -Khortych-1- will complement the arsenal of metal detectors
Description: About this reported on September 18 in the MOU. The universal metal detector was manufactured at a domestic enterprise, which developed and produced similar devices for use in domestic and industrial spheres: for detector research of soils and other surfaces for the presence of electric and gas networks, conducting geodetic work, performing other work in the field of national economy to detect metal objects objects, etc. It is noted that since the beginning of the large-scale invasion of the Russian Federation, the manufacturing company has voluntarily donated all existing metal detectors for use by the troops. The company's engineers constantly received feedback on the practical use of their products by the military and formed key criteria for the development of a universal army metal detector. -It had to be light, reliable in use, inexpensive, simple to use and repairable in the field,- the report said. The Ukrainian-made metal detector weighs a little more than a kilogram. -Detects explosive devices at a depth of more than half a meter with an error of 5 cm in the location of the center of the object. It works at temperatures from -20C to +40C and humidity up to 95%,- said the MOU. The device has light and sound mine detection indicators, a full charge of a powerful lithium-ion battery ensures the operation of the metal detector for 6 hours. The MOU reminded that manufacturers and developers of OVT samples with additional questions about the product codification process can contact the Main Directorate for Life Cycle Support of Weapons and Military Equipment by e-mail: mdalc@mil.ua. As reported by ArmyInform, the fleet of armored vehicles of the Ukrainian army has been replenished. a>one more sample of armored vehicles created using MRAP technology.

Title: MOU: Strengthening democratic civilian control is one of the key tasks of Euro-Atlantic integration
Description: About this he said in his speech at the beginning of a three-day training on democratic control of the Armed Forces. It is noted that this educational project is implemented with the support of the OSCE for representatives of the Ministry of Defense, the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, the National Defense University of Ukraine and public organizations. It is aimed at raising awareness and promoting democratic control over the Armed Forces regarding the rights and freedoms of servicemen, gender equality, interaction with civil society and integrity. -The Armed Forces of Ukraine should not be a closed structure. This is a requirement of our legislation and the best practices of partner states. Even in the face of full-scale war, it is important for us to continue to strengthen democratic civilian control, based on the principles of openness and transparency. This is a requirement and one of the key tasks of our Euro-Atlantic integration,- Stanislav Heyder said. According to him, the main expected results of the project, among other things, will be: Stanislav Heyder also noted that the Ministry of Defense is constantly working on strengthening democratic civilian control by reviewing and changing its own structure, as well as working out proposals for changes to legislation, which is carried out together with the parliament. Cooperation between the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine and the OSCE in the field of democratic civilian control has been ongoing since 2018. During this time, four annual projects have already been implemented. The current project will be completed in 2025. Title: Homemade explosives in Kyiv hypermarkets: a group of people who planned a series of terrorist attack...
Description: About informs September 18 SBU. Thanks to the evidence base collected by the Ukrainian special services, several perpetrators face life imprisonment with confiscation of property. -On the eve of May 9, those involved were preparing a series of large-scale explosions in construction hypermarkets and near cafes in Kyiv,- the report says. According to the case materials, the agents received such a task from their Russian supervisor, Yuri Syzov, a staff member of the Main Directorate of the General Staff of the Russian Armed Forces (better known as Gru). -According to his instructions, agents arrived in Kyiv, where they installed explosive devices in three construction hypermarkets. Homemade explosives were disguised in tea packages and were supposed to be detonated in hypermarkets in order to cause maximum damage to the civilian population,- the SBU said. At the same time, attackers were preparing another explosion near a popular cafe in the capital. For this, they planned to replace the car parked nearby. Counterintelligence and SBU investigators worked to anticipate and prevent a series of terrorist attacks. As a result of a multi-stage special operation, the subversive activities of the entire intelligence-combat group Gru together with its Russian curator were documented step by step. -The security service caught enemy agents red-handed when they were setting up explosive devices in the Kyiv hypermarket,- the SBU said. Later, they detained two more members of the enemy group. They turned out to be smugglers who were transporting explosives from Russia for perpetrators of terrorist attacks. According to the investigation, the explosives suppliers were to ensure the -evacuation- of one of the blasters to the territory of the Russian Federation on the order of the Russian game. It was planned to bring him to the border with Russia and provide detailed instruction on crossing it. In addition, as evidenced by the proceedings, Yuriy Syzov, an employee of the Russian Federation, was also responsible for the sabotage, which was to take place in Lviv Oblast in February 2024. Then the SBU once again acted in advance and prevented explosions at one of the defense enterprises. On the basis of the evidence collected by SBU investigators, the detainees will be tried in accordance with the crimes committed by them under the following articles of the Criminal Code of Ukraine: As reported by ArmyInform, a Kharkiv -blogger- who popularizedthe ideas of -Great Russia- and the USSR, he can spend 10 years behind bars.

Title: Kharkivskyi, a big Russian blogger, can spend ten years in prison
Description: informs the Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office about this. The New Bavarian District Prosecutor's Office of the city of Kharkiv has approved and sent to the court an indictment against a 25-year-old citizen for producing and distributing materials justifying the armed aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine. As well as the public use of communist symbols and propaganda of the communist totalitarian regime with the use of mass media (part 1, 3 of article 436-2, part 2 of article 436-1 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine). According to the investigation, the unemployed man from Kharkiv created his own channel on the YouTube video hosting service. Posing as a -blogger-, he popularized communist symbols of the USSR, praised the totalitarian regime and spread Kremlin narratives. He also used pages on Instagram and VKontakte, a Russian social network banned in Ukraine, to spread his views. The admirer of the Soviets accompanied the posts with images of the symbols of the communist totalitarian regime, including photos of the USSR flag, the red star badge, the October Revolution, as well as portraits of Lenin and Stalin. In addition, a resident of Kharkiv publicly in a local park imposed pro-Kremlin theses on passers-by that -NATO bases are being built on the territory of Ukraine, and Russia is forced to defend its lands.- In April 2024, law enforcement officers exposed a man. During a search of his residence, a computer and a mobile phone with evidence of illegal activities were seized, as well as a self-made communist symbol used by him during the filming of propaganda videos. The accused will be tried in the October District Court of Kharkiv. The maximum sanction of the articles provides for a penalty of up to ten years of imprisonment with confiscation of property. The pre-trial investigation was carried out by the Supreme Administrative Court No. 1 of the Khrupp No. 3 of the National Security Service of Ukraine in the Kharkiv region. Operational support — Office of the SBU in the Kharkiv region. As reported by ArmyInform,

Title: The Ministry of Defense told about updated sleeping bags for the military
Description: About this informs the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine. -The updated sleeping bag has several key improvements. In particular, it is lighter, has a water-repellent cover and is comfortable to use in any temperature. The weight has become less compared to the previous model and should not exceed 3.8 kg,- said Deputy Minister of Defense of Ukraine Dmytro Klimenkov. For example, the previous version of the sleeping bag was single-layer. Instead, the new version has three parts: an inner sleeping bag, a liner and an outer water-repellent cover. The liner protects the sleeping bag from the inside from dirt and natural moisture of the human body. The outer water-repellent and vapor-permeable cover helps protect the military from rain, snow, fog or wind. The modular system of the updated sleeping bag allows you to use it in different temperature conditions. For example, in a room, a soldier can sleep only in an inner bag, and on the street - in a full set. Also, the new sleeping system is made of a three-layer fabric with a membrane that provides high vapor permeability and retains heat. Thanks to the compression bag of the new model, the sleeping bag can be additionally pulled down and attached to the backpack together with the field carpet. The Ministry of Defense continues to work on improving the material and technical support of the Armed Forces. As reported by ArmyInform, by order of the leadership of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine inspection of the servicemen's catering system in the northern, eastern and southern directions continues.

In addition, she announced specific steps and decisions aimed at developing the capabilities of the Armed Forces of Ukraine to repel Russian aggression. -Sweden was and remains on the side of Ukraine in the war started by the Russian Federation. Further support and activation of military-political consultations within the framework of the signed bilateral security agreement is a good indication of our intentions,- said the head of defense policy at the Swedish Ministry of Defense, Victoria Malmer. Title: A traitor in the uniform of the Armed Forces was detained on the front line, who exchanged his comra...
Description: About informs Security Service of Ukraine. According to the military counterintelligence data of the SBU, the enemy was targeting the support and command posts of one of the armed forces brigades, which is holding defenses in the area of ​​the front-line city. In order to get the coordinates for fire damage, the occupiers remotely recruited a Ukrainian serviceman who serves in the same brigade. In exchange for cooperation, the FSB -guaranteed- its agent 1 million rubles. However, he never received the promised sum, because the topic of monetary -reward- was used exclusively by the Russian special service to recruit a traitor. Employees of the Security Service exposed the agent in advance and arrested him when he was recording the geolocation of the forward positions of the Armed Forces for the aggressor. At the place of detention, the suspect's mobile phone was seized, which he used to communicate with his Russian supervisor, an FSB operative. His identity has already been established. In addition, during the investigation, it was additionally established that, on the instructions of a Russian special service agent, the agent had to -merge- the organizational and staff structure of the FSB with the personnel of the Armed Forces brigade where he served. The occupiers hoped to use this information for new recruitment and to obtain intelligence on Pokrovsk's defenses. On the basis of the collected evidence, the investigators of the Security Service notified the detainee of suspicion under Part 2 of Art. 111 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (treason committed under martial law). The investigation is ongoing. The perpetrator is in custody. He faces up to life in prison with forfeiture of property. As reported by ArmyInform, a former employee of the DK -Ukroboronprom- was found guilty of treason . He was sentenced to 15 years in prison with confiscation of property.

Title: Running to the toilet: a massive stomach upset brought down the occupiers in Kharkiv Oblast

Due to the low quality of food and drinking water at the forward positions of the 11th Tank Regiment of the 18th Motorized Rifle Division, there are mass cases of gastrointestinal disorders among personnel and an urgent need for medicines. In connection with this, there is a decrease in the moral and psychological state of the occupiers. Near Liptsiv, the enemy is accumulating personnel in order to take further actions to restore the lost position, restore the communication system and elements of the fortification equipment of the positions of the 7th separate motorized rifle regiment of the 11th army corps. Enemy fortifications were damaged as a result of fire damage by the Defense Forces of Ukraine. The occupiers also replenished the ammunition of the regiment's mortar units. In the Staritsa area, the enemy carried out remote mining of the approaches to the positions, is carrying out the evacuation of casualties from several positions hit by the Defense Forces of Ukraine. In Vovchansk, the enemy established small groups of personnel of the 128th Separate Motorized Rifle Brigade of the 44th Army Corps and the volunteer reconnaissance-assault brigade -A. Nevsky- to advanced positions, along the way delivered medicines. Conducts measures to evacuate sanitary losses. During the past day, 1 combat clash took place in Vovchansk. the Russian occupiers also carried out 3 airstrikes using 8 anti-aircraft missiles and 30 kamikaze drone strikes. They carried out 402 shelling of the positions of the Defense Forces of Ukraine. The defense forces of Ukraine adequately respond to the actions of the enemy and continue to destroy the manpower, weapons and military equipment of the Russian occupiers. Enemy losses for the past day amount to 85 creatures, of which 24 are irretrievable, sanitary ones - 59. Two occupiers surrendered. Also the enemy lost destroyed and damaged 78 units of weapons and military equipment, in particular: In addition, in the Kharkiv direction, the Defense Forces destroyed 53 shelters for enemy personnel. Title: On the Day of the Savior, the occupiers attacked the rescuers: 10 people were injured in Kharkiv Obl...
Description: informed Oleg Synegubov, chief of Kharkiv OVA, about the consequences of enemy shelling of Kharkiv Region by the military of the Russian Federation Army during the past day . Yesterday at about 3:17 p.m. and 3:27 p.m., servicemen of the Russian army hit Kharkiv with aerial bombs. Both KAB strikes occurred in the Kyiv district of the city. As a result of the first blow, 8 people were injured, including four rescuers. Among the civilians, two men aged 25 and 33 and two women aged 19 and 22 were injured. The video of the consequences of the airstrike was made public at the Main Directorate of the State Emergency Service in the Kharkiv region. There it was reported that at the time of the enemy attack, rescuers were extinguishing a fire in a forest strip. Of the four injured employees of the State Emergency Service of Ukraine, three are in serious condition. Photos of the consequences of the shelling were made public by the Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office. Law enforcement officers have started a pre-trial investigation into the violation of the laws and customs of war. The prosecutor's office reported that the first hit by enemy ammunition took place on an open plot of land and on the territory of an industrial enterprise. Another munition fell in a forest strip, where rescuers were extinguishing the fire so that it did not spread to residential areas of the city. It has been established in advance that the enemy struck Kharkiv from the the builder of the Belgorod region of the Russian Federation with three FAB-250s from the UMPK. Photos of the consequences of enemy shelling of Kharkiv were also made public by the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Ukraine and distributed to the Main Directorate of the National Police of Ukraine in the Kharkiv region. As a result of the second strike on Kharkiv, a 15-year-old boy was injured and refused hospitalization. A fire broke out in a three-story administrative building. In the Kharkiv region, in the village of Odnorobivka, Zolochiv community, Bogodukhiv district, a 56-year-old woman was injured as a result of artillery shelling, and six two-story houses and 2 private houses were damaged. Also in Odnorobivka, as a result of shelling, a one-story residential building and grass in an open area on an area of ​​2 hectares burned. In the Kharkiv district, the villages of Tsupivka of the Dergachiv community and Cherkaska Lozova of the Malodanyliv community suffered from enemy shelling. In Tsupivka, a private house was damaged by shelling, in Cherkasska Lozova there was a fire in the ecosystem, burning grass on an area of ​​10 hectares. In the Kupyan district, the village of Podoli of the Kuriliv community was hit by an enemy attack, houses and farm buildings were on fire there. In the Izyum district, the Russian occupiers shelled the territory near the village of Zagryzove of the Borivska hromada, grass was burning there, grass was burning on an area of ​​0.4 hectares. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that the enemy hit Kharkiv: among 4 rescuers were injured.

Title: Overwhelm -Orlana-: how we manage to destroy Russian UAVs
Description: Military expert Petro Chernyk answered this question. — The enemy has now begun to lose many more unmanned aerial systems, especially high-altitude ones, which fly at an altitude of several kilometers. First of all, it is about their most massive reconnaissance unmanned complex -Orlan-10-, the expert notes. And he adds that a really breakthrough moment happened in the middle of this summer: - Our radio electronic struggle increased by an order of magnitude. The phenomenon consists in the fact that we managed not only to increase the production of the required amount (of REB means - Ed.), but also to greatly reduce its cost. The breakthrough did happen. And the state should be thanked for the fact that, by law, a number of restrictions were removed from the components that come to Ukraine. The second reason for the increase in the enemy's losses of operational-tactical UAVs is the improvement of the operation of portable anti-aircraft missile systems of various classes and types. — These are the same FIM-92 Stinger or excellent RBS-70 complexes, which have proven themselves very well… And we should mention one more unique thing - kamikaze drones: we have learned to use them to climb to great heights to enemy UAVs and destroy them, says a military expert. And he concludes that the three components he listed are what allowed our Defense Forces to raise the enemy UAV destruction rate so high. But Petro Chernyk advises not to be enchanted: — Because in the area of ​​radio-electronic warfare, the enemy has the second school in the world. He also knows how to work with REEs. And microelectronics can be obtained on world markets. He learns and learns quite quickly… At the same time, the expert notes that the level of destruction by our Defense Forces of such a number of operational-tactical level enemy UAVs is a truly unique phenomenon that has not yet occurred in this war. — If I had been told a year ago that it would be possible to approach the Orlan-10 with the help of another drone, and a smaller one, it would have only made me smile.

Title: 29 months of captivity. The history of the struggle, capture and return of the Hero of Ukraine Vikto...
Description: During the battles for surrounded Mariupol, on April 11, 2022, Viktor Ivchuk was awarded the title of Hero of Ukraine by the Decree of President Volodymyr Zelenskyi. And the very next day, April 12, Ivchuk was captured by the Russian Federation. The story of the officer's combat journey and resilience, 29 months of captivity and his return home is in the ArmyInform material. A military man originally from Vinnytsia. Studied at Mykola Pirogov Vinnytsia National Medical University. 2014 year. An officer in the 95th separate airborne assault brigade of the Armed Forces participated in battles in the east of our country. At that time, he was the head of the medical service. The fighting was heavy and intense, so Ivchuk, together with his comrades, provided first aid to wounded soldiers and civilians, and carried out their evacuation. On July 27, 2014, during the assault on the Savur Tomb, the officer received a shrapnel gunshot wound to the right hand. But, despite this, he organized a real special operation, thanks to which it was possible to evacuate 60 wounded from the battlefield. For this, Ivchuk was awarded the Order of Bohdan Khmelnytsky III degree. For several years, he held the post of deputy head of the military hospital in Dnipro, while simultaneously studying for a master's degree at the Ukrainian Military Medical Academy. A month before the beginning of the full-scale invasion of the Russian Federation, Colonel Ivchuk was transferred from Kyiv to Mariupol and appointed to the position of commander of the 555th military hospital. The hospital continued its work even after February 24, 2022, despite constant shelling by Russian troops. Until March 16, when the last building of the institution was destroyed by bombing at the same time as the Mariupol Drama Theater, where hundreds of civilians were hiding. Thanks to the efforts of hospital doctors, hundreds of lives of the defenders of Mariupol and its residents were saved. They worked despite everything, although operations had to be carried out under fire, in basements, in helmets and body armor. In March 2022, a bomb hit the hospital - the facility was targeted by the enemy. All the medical personnel, together with the wounded, divided into two groups. The first one was to join the Ukrainian military at Azovstal. The other, including Commander Viktor Ivchuk, went to the Ilyich metallurgical plant. On April 11, 2022, the head of the Mariupol military hospital, colonel of the medical service, Viktor Ivchuk, was awarded the title of Hero of Ukraine with the award of the -Golden Star- order. -On April 11, 2022, by the decree of President Volodymyr Zelensky, my husband was awarded the title of Hero of Ukraine. In the morning, I received telephone greetings, and I knew nothing about the decree - it was not at all before that. The next day I received a message from an unknown number: -We are being taken prisoner.- I had a mixed feeling. On the one hand, she was happy that her husband was still alive, albeit in captivity. At that time, no one even imagined what Russian captivity was. On the other hand, it was very infuriating that the occupiers, contrary to the norms of international humanitarian law and the Geneva Convention on the Treatment of Prisoners of War, forcibly deprived the doctors of their freedom. They should have let them go! But no. They said they would trade them for their military,- recalls Victoria Ivchuk. The wife remembers the last phone conversation with her husband at the beginning of April 22nd - he was saying goodbye to her and her son. What followed were 29 long months of enemy captivity. According to his wife (and she was told this by military men who had been released from captivity earlier), the leadership of the colony in Olenivka allowed our medics, including Viktor, to treat and care for the wounded, whom they took out of Mariupol. But when the terrorist attack happened, they were not allowed to join the victims. People were burning alive, but no one was saving them. And a year after that tragedy in Olenivka, his wife Viktoria received a letter with a stamp of the Russian post office on the envelope. In the envelope was a piece of paper with a few lines: -I'm fine.- She recognized Victor's handwriting. But there was no date in the letter - it was difficult to understand when it was written. As it turned out later, shortly after the prisoners were taken from Olenivka to Stary Oskol, the colony distributed to everyone the same pieces of paper with the identical text: -Everything is fine with me.- Victoria, together with the families of captured and missing doctors, created the public organization -Military Doctors of Ukraine-, which included relatives of prisoners from Kherson region, Donetsk region, and Kharkiv region. Together, they gathered all the information related to the prisoners, which was transmitted by the relevant authorities. The NGO cooperates with governmental, human rights and public organizations. Has its own site. In June of this year, Victoria and other women, whose relatives defended Mariupol and are illegally held in Russian torture camps, had an audience with the Pope and asked him to facilitate the release of Ukrainian prisoners of war. During the meeting, Victoria Ivchuk presented the pontiff with a symbolic medical gown with photos of captured doctors. The officer returned to Ukraine after the exchange on September 13, 2024. His son, wife, parents and brother were waiting for him. Photos from Victoria Ivchuk's personal archive and from open sources

Title: Wounded in battle: about payments to defenders during treatment
Description: ArmyInform explains when and what wounded defenders can receive and why payments may stop. By the way, currently all social guarantees also apply to those military personnel who perform combat missions outside Ukraine - on the territory of the aggressor state. In the event of injury to a military serviceman, the payment of financial support for the last position held for the entire period of treatment is preserved. Currently it can continue not more than 12 consecutive months. Here we are talking about the time a military man spends in hospitals or hospitals, as well as medical leave. This usually takes several months. If there is a need for longer treatment, then no later than 4 months after the start of treatment, you need to undergo VLC. It is on the basis of this decision that the payment of financial support should continue in the future. Tip: During the entire period of treatment or medical leave, stay in touch with your immediate commander and report any changes. Our own experience shows that this prevents payment problems. This payment is included in the list of additional rewards. In the army, it is better known as -combat-. She is also a wounded soldier assigned. But there are certain nuances. When is it paid? Now about the nuances. The basis for this payment is a certificate about the circumstances of the injury (injury, contusion, mutilation), so-called form 5. It must be provided in a military unit. And it must be stated that the injury is related to the defense of the Motherland. If there is no such wording in the certificate, then the money will most likely not be credited. The certificate must also state that the serviceman was wearing personal protective equipment, did not commit a criminal offense, did not attempt to injure himself, and was not under the influence of alcohol or drugs. All the listed items are grounds for refusing to pay additional compensation. One more nuance. After discharge from the hospital, the -combat- 100,000 should continue to be paid only if you are sent on leave for treatment due to a serious injury. This should be spelled out in the conclusion of the VLK. If the injury is not serious, then the payment of 100,000 is stopped. It is also worth remembering that this additional reward is calculated in proportion to the number of days. That is, as well as -combat- (for example, if you were in the hospital for 20 days, then the additional reward will be approximately 65 thousand hryvnias). If additional reward after wounding is not paid, then a report should be written in the name of the commander for inclusion in the order for payment of additional reward and a copy of the certificate of wounding should be attached to this report. If the payment is refused, and you consider it illegal, you can contact the hotline of the Ministry of Defense or lawyers. Case law shows that, as a rule, military personnel are still credited with all guaranteed benefits, if there are grounds for this. Wounding of servicemen is one of the grounds for the payment of material assistance for solving social and household issues. This is defined by decision of the Minister of Defense dated September 16 January 2024. Such assistance may be paid once a year in the amount of a monthly allowance. More about how to get this help can be read here. If the injury resulted in disability or partial loss of working capacity, in this case you can also count on one-time cash assistance. Its size depends on the established disability group and the subsistence minimum for able-bodied persons, which is revised every year. If the disability occurred as a result of an injury during the performance of military service duties, then the following payment amounts have been established in 2024: One-time assistance is provided not only in the event of injury during the performance of military service duties, but also , who received a disability during military service as a result of illness or injury. The amount of the benefit also depends on the set disability group: A one-time benefit is provided in case of partial disability. The Medical and Social Expert Commission (MSEK) must establish the degree of disability in percentage. The amount of payment will depend on the established degree. For servicemen who are partially disabled due to injury (contusion, trauma or mutilation), illness during the performance of military service duties, the basic amount from which the amount of payment will be calculated is 211,960 hryvnias. For example, if the MSEK established a 20% loss of working capacity for you, then the one-time benefit amount will be UAH 42,392. Finally, one more piece of advice: keep all medical documents (form No. 100, conclusions of VLK, MSEK, certificate on the circumstances of the injury, etc.). Without them, it will be very problematic to prove your right to payments later.

Title: There is fake creativity in the swamps again: screenshots of fake orders of the Ministry of Defense ...
Description: So, recently, a photo of order No. 274t dated September 4, 2024, allegedly from the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine, has been circulating on the Internet, in which, with the aim of -following European values-, they order to create special conditions of service for -servicemen representing LGBTQ+-. Also, full-time psychologists of military units are supposed to conduct testing of personnel for belonging to these communities. The so-called document is fake, as is its content. First, the -order- does not meet the requirements of official record keeping. Secondly, the Chief of the General Staff cannot sign the order of the Ministry of Defense. Thirdly, the content of the fake document contradicts at least the Constitution of Ukraine and several laws. In addition, this is not the first time that Russian fakers have tried to ridicule and humiliate LGBT+ representatives, including the military. In the face of a large-scale invasion, Russia describes itself as a territory for everyone who believes exclusively in -traditional values.- And Ukraine is trying to be shown as a country where the authorities are forcibly engaged in -LGBTzation- of citizens. In this way, the aggressor country demonstrates its disdain for the democratic system, opposing it to the -Russian measure-.

Title: For the first time, Ukrainian companies will be able to participate in tenders of the Drone Coalitio...
Description: About this informs September 17 Ministry of Defense of Ukraine. The series of tenders includes two lots: for the production of advanced FPV drones and interceptor drones. Ukrainian companies are invited to participate in these tenders for the first time, which is an important step to support domestic production. To participate in the tender, manufacturers must register on the website Ministry of Defense of Great Britain and submit your applications. Proposals for FPV drones are accepted until October 14th and for interceptor drones until November 11th. All submitted applications will be reviewed by members of the Drone Coalition, after which the winners will be selected. The companies that win the tenders will receive orders for the production of drones for further testing and evaluation. If the test results are successful, a large-scale order of FPV drones from the winning companies is planned. -The goal of this coalition is to ensure the industrial production of FPV drones in order to create a technological advantage over the enemy in the long term,- said Kateryna Chernogorenko, Deputy Minister of Defense of Ukraine for Digitalization. According to her, it is important not only to scale up production in the West, but also to support Ukrainian companies capable of producing such equipment. Therefore, the MOU for the first time involves domestic manufacturers to participate in tenders. We remind you that the Coalition of Drones was created in February 2024 during the 19th meeting in the format -Rammstein-. The initiative is proposed by Latvia and coordinated together with Great Britain. The Coalition includes 16 partner countries that already supply Ukraine with drones. With accumulated funds in the amount of 50 million euros, it is planned to purchase another 20-30 thousand drones. As reported by ArmyInform, the Minister of Defense Rustem Umyerov informed about -koalicziya-morskyh-spromozhnostej/->important results according to the results of the 24th meeting Contact group on issues of support to Ukraine in the Rammstein format.
