Title: Higher military educational institutions joined the Course for Trainers on Gender Issues
Description: In cooperation with the Nordic Center for Gender Issues in Military Operations (NCGM), the Croatian Armed Forces (CAF), the Konrad Adenauer Foundation (KAS), the participants received comprehensive training on the implementation of gender perspectives within military operations. The course was opened by the director of RACVIAC Kostiantyn Mykhailo-Grigorije, the representative of the Northern Center of Military Operations, Lt. Col. Lena Quarving, and the official of the Ministry of Defense of the Republic of Croatia, Katarina Adzic. -I was especially inspired by the opportunity to communicate with Ukrainian military women - Colonel Natalia Lytvynenko, freelance adviser to the head of the Military Institute of Taras Shevchenko Kyiv National University, and Olena Pavlova, freelance adviser to the head of the Yevgeny Bereznyak Military Academy on gender issues. Our discussions highlighted the long-standing understanding of the crucial role of gender in conflicts, using the example of Ukraine. It was a great honor for me to share my experience, to highlight the critical importance of gender mainstreaming,- said the panel discussion speaker, Advisor to the Minister of National Defense of Portugal, Diana Morais. 21 participants from security sector institutions from RACVIAC member countries, Ukraine, Jordan, NATO SHAPE, NCGM and PSOTC participated in in-depth distributed learning, lectures, discussions, syndicated work and individual case studies according to the NATO-certified NCGM program. GToT, a course organized by RACVIAC under the auspices of the Northern Center for Gender in Military Operations (NCGM), provides essential tools and strategies for training on gender issues in the military. RACVIAC is focused on advancing gender equality through high-quality training programs and partnerships aimed at fostering collaboration and driving meaningful change in the security sector.

Title: An ex-employee of Ukroboronprom was found guilty of treason
Description: The General Prosecutor's Office informed about this on September 17. Prosecutors proved in court that in 2022, an employee of the defense complex went over to the side of the enemy in order to fulfill the task of the Russian special services to collect and transfer detailed information of a military nature to them. During the defense of Kyiv Oblast, in the spring of 2022, the convict gave information about the results of rocket and artillery shelling of the capital and surrounding territories to the curator, an intermediary of the Ministry of Defense of the Russian Federation. After rocket attacks on residential buildings in Kyiv, a man sent photos from the site of damage, images of damaged structures with the exact address, and fragments of the munitions used to strike. In addition, he repeatedly reported to the enemy detailed information about the positions, numbers and movement routes of the Defense Forces of Ukraine, as well as the location of roadblocks, engineering fortifications and weapons depots in the Kyiv region. The representatives of the Russian Federation used the received data to launch new attacks on Ukrainian positions. As a result of the public indictment of the prosecutors of the Vinnytsia Regional Prosecutor's Office, a former employee of the DK -Ukroboronprom- was found guilty of treason (Part 2, Article 111 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine). The convict's illegal actions were exposed at the beginning of 2023. He was waiting for the court verdict in custody. He did not admit his guilt in court. As reported by ArmyInform, law enforcement officers also investigation into the alleged execution of a Ukrainian serviceman by representatives of the Russian Federation.

Title: Shoot or surrender: the Armed Forces explained the choice of the Russians
Description: The choice of the Russians explained in an interview for ArmiyaInform, the spokesman of OTU -Kharkiv-, Colonel Vitaly Sarantsev. — Surrender is considered something shameful, if a person surrendered even wounded and unable to continue fighting, they still consider him a traitor and a criminal, even his closest relatives disown him very often, he said. This attitude towards prisoners in Russian society also prompts Russian soldiers to die or commit suicide in order not to surrender. — Some of them prefer to self-destruct — shoot themselves, blow themselves up with a grenade, or even strangle themselves with an Esmarch harness — than surrender to captivity, Vitaliy Sarantsev said. In addition, Russian propaganda widely spreads allegations that Ukrainians mistreat prisoners. This is not true, but the occupying soldiers believe it. Read more read about it in a big interview with Vitaliy Sarantseva ArmiyaInform. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that the Russians found a way to replenish losses on the front.

Title: As a result of the Russian attack on Glukhov, the elevator was seriously damaged. There are wounded
Description: This was announced on September 17 by the -North- operational command. The occupiers dropped, according to preliminary data, three SAMs (guided aerial bombs). As a result of the enemy attack, two wounded: a father and a son, who are 64 and 34 years old, respectively, were reported to the Sumy regional prosecutor's office. At least 20 private homes, a vehicle and an elevator were also damaged. As reported by ArmyInform, a person died in Sumy Oblast /a> as a result of a Russian attack on an energy facility.

Title: PPBE's new model of defense management will be tested by the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation ...
Description: About this informs September 17 MOU. The purpose of this model is to support informed management decisions in the field of defense. The pilot implementation of the new model will be carried out on the basis of a certain type, a separate type of troops (forces) of the Armed Forces of Ukraine by the end of 2025. After the adoption of appropriate changes to the current legislation, the model is planned to be extended to all components of the Defense Forces. -The new approach, among other things, involves planning the development and maintenance of the capabilities of the Armed Forces, and in the future, other components of the Defense Forces, for the medium (5 years) and long-term (10 years) perspective,- the message reads. Aspects of this model include a clear distribution of expenditures by key areas based on a multi-criteria analysis of the development of defense capabilities. Such analysis is used to calculate the cost of each capability, taking into account real resource needs. Determines the life cycles and effectiveness of weapons and military equipment for each type, separate type of troops (forces) of the Armed Forces. -In the process of improving the defense management system, our task is to arm ourselves with new effective methods, synchronize and gain interoperability with our foreign partners in the application of progressive planning processes,- said First Deputy Minister of Defense, Lieutenant General Ivan Gavrylyuk. According to him, another task is to form a clear vision of the prospects of the capabilities of the Ukrainian army at the next stages of development, using new analysis tools. By the end of the current year, the target model of the transformation of the defense management system and the road map for the implementation of the PPBV process will be sent for review to the interested executive authorities and specialized committees of the Verkhovna Rada. As reported by ArmyInform, previously the IOU successfully completed a cycle of joint governance courses aimed at increasing the efficiency of decision-making and implementation in the department.

Title: Anchor them in the bay: the marines shot the tank and the crew of the Russians with drones
Description: This was reported by the Defense Forces of Southern Ukraine. -Aerial scouts with the help of attack drones hit an enemy tank and its personnel. Now minus one Russian tank will pose a threat to Ukrainian defenders. Glory to Ukraine! Glory to the marines!- - added in the Defense Forces of the South. Formerly ArmyInform showed how the 61st separate mechanized Steppe brigade captured 13 Russians during the battles in Kurshchyna.

Title: Oleksandr Zavitnevich told what the Kursk operation of the Armed Forces of Ukraine is for Putin
Description: About it on Facebook wrote the head of the Committee of the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine on National Security, Defense and Intelligence Oleksandr Zavitnevich. -Russia understands only force - one of the main conclusions that the Ukrainians in alliance with their partners proved during the years of the great war of the Russian Federation against Ukraine. Another conclusion, which Ukraine knows well from the history of interaction with an aggressive neighbor, is that the indecision of those who possess this greater power to force the Russian Federation to accept the proposed conditions for the cessation of aggression motivates Moscow in any way to look for an opportunity to freeze the final and fair resolution of the problem. And all this in order to wait for the right opportunity and implement all their insidious aggressive plans, rejecting all previous agreements,- – the post says. According to Oleksandr Zavitnevich, all the peace-making rhetoric of the Kremlin is the art of quackery and quackery. It can make a certain impression, but at the level of a political show. -The Kursk operation of the Armed Forces of Ukraine is a real political knockdown of Putin, it highlighted the entire current state of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation, the management system. Even in the information space of the enemy, sometimes, albeit short-lived, signs of intelligence - the leadership of the Russian Federation is not so wise and far-sighted and that under his tenure, the Russian Federation is in for a disaster. Right now is the right moment to beat the enemy, not to give him a chance to recover, to recover, to end this war on fair terms by signing them at the Second Peace Summit initiated by Ukraine-, – the head of the Committee notes. And he adds that it is important that the partners finally agree to President Volodymyr Zelenskyi's proposal to give Ukraine permission to use long-range weapons deep into the territory of the Russian Federation: -The national resistance of Ukrainians did everything possible to ensure that the Europeans avoided trenches and air strikes. In order for the heroism and sacrifices of Ukrainians not to be in vain, so that the Russian beast does not invade Europe, only one thing is needed - the appropriate decisions of our partners in support of Volodymyr Zelenskyi's proposals-. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that Oleksandr Zavitnevich spoke about the planned changes to the Law on Mobilization.

Title: He was performing a partisan mission behind enemy lines: the drones joined the rescue operation
Description: The National Guard of Ukraine published the relevant video on September 17 on its channel. -In the rear of the enemy, in the temporarily occupied territories, the man performed a partisan mission and identified enemy positions, after which he had to swim across the river to successfully evacuate,- the defenders said. It is noted that several brigades of the State Security Service and the National Guard took part in the rescue operation, and defenders from the 11th Brigade named after M. Hrushevsky threw three lifebuoys to him and helped him evacuate to a safe place. Earlier ArmyInform showed how units of the Airborne Assault Troops of the Armed Forces of Ukraine in to one of the settlements of the Kursk region by concerted actions >knocked down a modern Russian BMD-4 landing combat vehicle.

Title: They staged sabotage on the railway: three arsonists were detained
Description: About inform September 17 in the SBU. According to the case materials, two of the detainees are brothers. The third is a mutual acquaintance of theirs. -The perpetrators were recruited by the Russian special services through Telegram channels, where they were looking for 'easy money.' At first, only the brothers were engaged in subversive activities,- the report says. At the beginning of September, a Russian curator came to them and gave them a -test- task: for a small reward, make seven provocative graffiti on different streets of Chernivtsi. After that, a representative of the Russian special services proposed a -more serious- job - to set fire to relay cabinets, which was supposed to disrupt rail traffic in the region. -The perpetrators committed the first arson, and in the second they involved their acquaintance, an unemployed man from Chernivtsi,- the SBU said. As evidenced by the proceedings, the three of them planned to carry out all subsequent arsons. The Security Service of Ukraine and the National Police prevented further arsons and arrested all three perpetrators -on hot pursuit.- During the searches of their residences, mobile phones with evidence of subversive activities for the benefit of the Russian Federation were seized. The SBU investigators informed the suspects about the suspicion for h. 2 Art. 28 and h. 2 Art. 113 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (sabotage committed by a group of persons under martial law in accordance with a previous conspiracy). The extras are in custody, facing up to life in prison. As reported by ArmyInform, SBU Counterintelligenceexposedanother agent group of the Main Directorate of the General Staff of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation (more known as a game) that operated in Zaporozhye. The perpetrators were preparing coordinates for Russian airstrikes on military and critical infrastructure facilities in the region.

Title: Total resistance: SSO calls to shake off the stinking wreckage of a rotten empire
Description: A video with a call to join the Resistance Movement was published on the Telegram channel of the Special Operations Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. -We are the people of Ukraine, we are total resistance to the defense of independence. We are everywhere. We see everything. We are at home. We are the land that holds us and collapses under the foot of the occupier. We are a fire that warms our own and burns the enemy. We are the water that waters Ukraine and drowns the invader. We are the air that Ukrainians breathe freely, and the air that poisons Russians,- the SSO said in a statement. The special forces emphasized that the resistance movement is spreading and gathering momentum to shake off the stinking ruins of the rotten empire from Ukraine. -Every day we are getting closer to victory over our archenemy. We are at home, so no one will rule here but us!- - emphasized the soldiers. You can join the Resistance Movement by following the link. As ArmyInform wrote, in Digital recruiting will be launched in Ukraine: the first details from the Ministry of Defense.

Title: - Sooner or later, Kharkiv will be under the Russian Federation - law enforcement officers detained ...
Description: Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office informs about this. Under the procedural guidance of the Kharkiv District Prosecutor's Office of the Kharkiv Region, a 36-year-old woman was informed of suspicion of justifying, recognizing as legitimate the armed aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine (Chapter 1, Article 3, Article 436-2 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine). According to the investigation, the unemployed resident of the city of Lubotyn, having plenty of free time, actively promoted pro-Kremlin narratives on the Internet. The woman systematically distributed comments in one of the pro-Russian groups in the Telegram messenger. Yes, the person involved wrote that Russia should hit the buildings of state authorities in Ukraine with missiles. In addition, she indicated the following: -Sooner or later, Kharkiv will be under the Russian Federation.- However, most of her comments were about Ukrainian defenders. The woman systematically humiliated the Defense Forces, wishing them dead. And she did not stop there. The commentator managed to accuse the Kharkiv authorities of disseminating information about the mining of one of the local cemeteries. In her opinion, this is a fake. She wrote that the officials do not want Kharkiv residents to see -sticks with rags- - these are the cynical and humiliating words the admirer of -Russian world- described the graves of Ukrainian soldiers. Law enforcement officers exposed the woman. The department emphasized that Kharkiv under the Russian flag will remain only in her thoughts, while in reality the accused faces a maximum of eight years in prison with confiscation of property. As reported by ArmyInform, at the Zaporizhzhia Defense Plant /->detained a woman--rat- who worked for Russia.

Title: White is the hit of the season: 13 Russians effectively surrendered
Description: This was reported by the Commander of the Ground Forces of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, Lieutenant General Oleksandr Pavliuk. -The ground forces continue to replenish the exchange fund. Kursk operation. After 5 days of fierce fighting, the enemy was left without water and ammunition. As a result, the white flag will be raised,- said the Commander of the Ground Forces Oleksandr Pavlyuk added that on that day a separate mechanized Steppe Brigade of the Ground Forces captured 13 Russians, 4 of them were seriously wounded. Earlier, ArmyInform showed how in the South the aerial reconnaissance of the State Border Service discovered a well-disguised vehicle of the occupiers, and operators of strike drones promptly destroyed it.

Title: Conscripts are replacing stormtroopers: the Russians have found a way to replenish losses on the fro...
Description: Vitaly Sarantsev, the spokesman of OTU -Kharkiv-, reported this on the -Suspilne Novosti- broadcast. -In order to take personnel from secondary tasks, the enemy replaces stormtroopers or those who are capable of conducting assaults at all with conscripts who perform secondary tasks,- he said. Instead, those servicemen who were freed due to such rotations are redirected by the Russian command directly to conduct offensive actions. At the same time, conscripts who perform special tasks to ensure logistics on the territory of the Russian Federation are in the same risk zone as any other servicemen of the Russian army. — We inflict fire damage on the enemy, wherever he is. And if his forces and means appear in the range of our FPV drones or artillery, then, accordingly, they are destroyed even at the stage of advancing towards the Ukrainian border, the spokesman noted. The military man emphasized that, as a result, conscripts of the Russian army are also dying on Russian territory. In addition, Vitaly Sarantsev reminded that in Russia there is a practice of enlisting conscripts into combat operations after 4 months of service. — They are agitating conscripts who have served certain terms to switch to contract service. They are promised a powerful social package so that they have already moved to another status and they can be involved in directly conducting hostilities, the military explained. So, despite the fact that Russian conscripts currently perform tasks of a secondary nature, they are already participating in hostilities and are a legitimate military target. Earlier, ArmyInform told, how the Russians use strokoviks in the Kharkiv direction.

Title: The trick of the Carpathian -molfar-: turned 20,000 packs of butter into margarine for the military
Description: This was reported by the Special Prosecutor's Office of the Western Region. According to the investigation, the entrepreneur, on the basis of the contract concluded in June 2023 with the Ministry of Defense to provide the military with high-quality food, ignored the requirements of state standards and instead of 20,000 packages of butter, organized the delivery of margarine of unknown origin. In this way, the military units got a fabricated product that does not meet the parameters established by the regulations. In addition, on the basis of false documents, he was able to get a settlement, and later to legalize the funds with the help of financial transactions. The amount of damages reached more than half a million hryvnias. Currently, the businessman has been informed of the suspicion and a precautionary measure has been taken. Involvement in the crime of other persons is checked. Earlier ArmyInform reported that a Kharkiv businesswoman who financed the production of Russian weapons through a business partner from Moscow will stand trial.

Title: Logistics - in manual mode - in Kharkiv Oblast forces the occupiers to surrender
Description: Vitaly Sarantsev, the spokesman of OTU -Kharkiv-, reported this on the -Suspilne Novosti- broadcast. Cases when the enemy surrenders in the Kharkiv direction have become more frequent. Yesterday, there were two Russian prisoners in the north of Kharkiv region, and today four occupiers surrendered. — The adversary is forced to find new routes for logistics, to change logistics methods. If earlier he used the technique in some places, now he does all this exclusively in manual mode, that is, he carries everything by hand, he said. This situation arose as a result of the successful actions of the Defense Forces, primarily fighters from the UAV units, who broke the supply chains in the enemy's near rear with the help of bomber drones and kamikaze drones. — An opponent who has been in advanced positions for a long time does not receive adequate support. We manage to break the logistics chains and, accordingly, they sit without food, without water. Of course, this in a certain way affects their moral and psychological state and they prefer to surrender themselves to captivity than to return to their commanders, to the inhumane treatment that is organized in them directly in the places, the spokesman explained. The military emphasized that the motivational measures for the personnel of the Russian occupying forces by the enemy command have the opposite effect to what the Russians wanted. — They only contribute to the enemy losing faith in the military and political leadership and, accordingly, they choose the right path for themselves in terms of surrendering, — Vitaly Sarantsev concluded. The spokesman said that cases of desertion of the Russian military are currently observed in several areas of the Kharkiv direction - in the Vovchansk region, near Hlyboky and Lukyantsi. -The personnel have a certain percentage of demoralization and refuse to follow orders, refuse to carry out combat missions, refuse to carry out special tasks of casualty evacuation or logistical support,- he said. The military expressed hope that this trend will continue and strengthen. The Ukrainian military is interested and takes the necessary measures to make the enemy understand that his only chance to stay alive is surrender. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that in the Kharkiv direction to surrender the occupiers are being captured by hopelessness, recently the number of captives has increased.

Title: A sword was stuck in the body: prosecutors began an investigation into the execution of a Ukrainian ...
Description: This is reported by the Office of the Prosecutor General. Under the procedural leadership of the Donetsk regional prosecutor's office, a pre-trial investigation into criminal proceedings has been initiated for violation of the laws and customs of war, combined with intentional murder (Part 2 of Article 438 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine). In particular, on September 17, 2024, one of the Telegram channels published a post about the probable execution of a Ukrainian defender by representatives of the SSR in the city of Novogrodivka. The released photos show that the occupiers stuck a sword into the body of a serviceman of the Defense Forces of Ukraine. In the image, the slain serviceman is missing his equipment and has sticky tape on one of his hands. The criminal regime continues its purposeful policy of destroying everything Ukrainian, demonstrating to the whole world its monstrous cruelty and cynically disregarding any values ​​and norms of the civilized world. -Our goal is to find and punish everyone involved in these crimes. The world must see the atrocities of the occupiers and respond decisively to every such case. Only by joint efforts can we punish this evil,- General Prosecutor Andriy Kostin emphasized. A number of urgent investigative and search operations are currently underway. The circumstances of the offense are being investigated in order to identify the involved and guilty persons. Within the framework of the criminal proceedings, orders and inquiries are directed to the relevant competent services and institutions. The pre-trial investigation is carried out by investigators of the State Security Service of Ukraine in the Donetsk and Luhansk regions. As reported by ArmyInform, the occupiers killed a Ukrainian prisoner of war with a sword.

Title: A female rat who worked for Russia was detained at the Zaporizhzhia defense plant
Description: About this informs Security Service of Ukraine. Among the priority targets of the enemy were air defense systems, deployment points of the Defense Forces and enterprises of the defense-industrial complex. The occupiers were also interested in the routes of transporting Ukrainian weapons and ammunition to the front line. According to the case materials, two residents of Zaporozhye turned out to be agents of the Russian military intelligence. One of the detainees is an employee of the Zaporizhia Strategic Defense Plant. The woman gave the enemy information about the location of workshops where military products are produced, and also reported on missile damage to the enterprise where she worked. Another SBU agent was caught red-handed when he spied on units of the Armed Forces of Ukraine based in Zaporizhzhia. To collect data, the person involved not only went around the city, but also -darkly- asked for the information he needed during everyday conversations with acquaintances. During searches, mobile phones and computer equipment with evidence of working for the enemy were found in the possession of the suspects. -Currently, the investigators of the Security Service have informed the agents about the suspicion under Part 2 of Art. 111 (treason committed under martial law) and part 3 of Art. 114-2 (unauthorized dissemination of information about the movement, movement or location of the Armed Forces) of the Criminal Code of Ukraine,- the message reads. The suspects are being held without bail. They face life imprisonment with confiscation of property. Documenting the crime was carried out by SBU counterintelligence agents in Zaporizhzhia region and employees of the Main Directorate of SBU in Donetsk and Luhansk regions under the procedural guidance of regional prosecutors' offices. As reported by ArmyInform, the end of the saboteur's career: detained a man from Chernihiv who was helping to destroy his own city.

Title: Individually and in groups: -tankers- of the Russian Federation are thrown -on the front line- in th...
Description: Detailed information about the situation and enemy losses in the Kharkiv direction informed in Kharkiv OTU. In the area of ​​the settlement Hlyboke, the enemy is carrying out a single movement of personnel with the aim of replenishing the current shortage in the forward positions of the 11th tank regiment of the 18th motorized rifle division. Near Lukyantsiv, the enemy is building up a communication system, has carried out logistical support measures, and established a group of servicemen at the position of the 380th Motorized Rifle Regiment of the 47th Tank Division of the 1st Tank Army with the aim of preparing for assault operations. In Vovchansk, the Russian occupiers carried out measures to evacuate sanitary casualties and logistical support, strengthened the assault groups of the 128th separate motorized rifle brigade of the 44th army corps. In the area of ​​the settlement Tikhe, the main focus was on conducting aerial reconnaissance with the aim of identifying units of the Defense Forces of Ukraine. During the past 24 hours, there have been 2 combat clashes. the Russian occupiers carried out 1 airstrike using 1 anti-aircraft missile and 26 kamikaze drone strikes. 321 shelling of positions of Ukrainian defenders was carried out. The defense forces of Ukraine respond adequately to the actions of the enemy and continue to destroy the manpower, weapons and military equipment of the Russian occupiers. The enemy's losses over the past day amounted to 62 creatures, of which 10 were irretrievable, and 48 were sanitary. Four occupiers surrendered as prisoners. Also, in our direction, the enemy lost destroyed and damaged 59 units of weapons and military equipment, in particular: Also in the Kharkiv direction, the Defense Forces destroyed 35 shelters for personnel, an ammunition storage area, and 3 UAV launch pads. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that in the area of ​​the Aggregate Plant in Vovchansk, the occupiers hit their own units with anti-aircraft missiles.

Title: Institute for the study of war and media: the Armed Forces explained how to avoid distorting the fac...
Description: On this emphasized the spokesman of OTU -Kharkiv- Vitaly Sarantsev in an interview with ArmiyaInform. — The Institute for the Study of War is an authoritative resource that analyzes the situation based on open data. However, its reports are often based on a large amount of information from various sources, which may change or be incomplete. At the same time, ISW does not distinguish between official and unofficial sources and very often uses propagandistic Russian materials in its analysis, he said. Voiskovy emphasized that credit should be given to the Institute's analysts, because they always refer to sources of information, providing a list of everything they used during the preparation of the report. At the same time, he noted that the Ukrainian media often unjustifiably perceive the Institute's messages as a definitive fact, thus presenting society with a distorted picture of events. — This undermines our work, the work of the official communication channels of the military-political leadership of the state, the work of communicators of the Armed Forces and Defense Forces as a whole. We are conducting a defense operation in which every action, including informing the public, must be subordinated to the interests of defense. Using unverified information, even taking it from such a powerful resource as the Institute for the Study of War, one can unknowingly play along with the enemy, the spokesman emphasized. More about the information space of modern war read in the great interview of Vitaly Sarantseva ArmiyaInform. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that Ministry of Defense officials held a meeting with the delegation of the Institute for the Study of War, emphasizing that The Institute for the Study of War is one of the well-known analytical centers whose work helps the world see the real state of affairs during the Russian aggression against Ukraine.

Title: They risk themselves, but help others: the President congratulated the rescuers

They risk themselves, but help others. -Our rescuers are always where they are needed most. Thank you for your courage! Thank you for saving the lives of our people!- — emphasized Volodymyr Zelenskyi. As reported by ArmyInform, rescuers showed rescue of an elderly woman from under the rubble in the Kharkiv region.

Title: The occupiers executed a Ukrainian prisoner of war with a sword
Description: This was reported by Dmytro Lubinets on his Telegram channel. -The level of barbarism and bloodthirstiness is unfathomable. Such actions are a gross violation of the Geneva Convention on the Treatment of Prisoners of War,- – emphasized the Commissioner. Dmytro Lubinets noted that the world should stop looking at how Russia openly shows disdain for any norms and laws. The ombudsman sent letters to international organizations, the ICRC and the UN, asking them to record yet another violation of human rights by Russia. Separately, he emphasized that such show executions are aimed at demoralizing Ukrainian society. However, seeing such actions, we must become even more determined in the fight against the aggressor. Title: Kupyanshchyna under enemy fire: four people were injured in the Kharkiv region
Description: informed Oleg Synegubov, chief of Kharkiv OVA, about the consequences of enemy attacks on Kharkiv Oblast during the past day. In the city of Kupyansk, as a result of enemy shelling, a 65-year-old woman and a 63-year-old woman were injured, and three private houses were destroyed. In the Izyum district, the village of Bohuslavka was hit by enemy attacks, a private house was damaged there, and forest litter on an area of ​​20 hectares was on fire. In the village of Nova Kozacha, Dergachiv community, Kharkiv district, grass on an area of ​​300 square meters burned as a result of shelling. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that occupiers carried out an airstrike on Bogodukhov.

Title: A moment of silence in Ukraine
Description: -In order to honor the bright memory, civic courage and self-sacrifice, strength of spirit, resilience and heroic deed of the soldiers who fell during the execution of combat missions to protect the state sovereignty and territorial integrity of Ukraine, civilians who died as a result of the armed aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine , I decree: to start holding a nationwide minute of silence every day at 9:00 a.m. for compatriots who died as a result of the armed aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine, to be announced in all mass media regardless of the form of ownership,- the document says.

Title: Our soldiers hit two -other important objects of the occupiers-
Description: This is reported by the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. In general, along the entire line of battle, the Ukrainian defenders inflict significant losses in manpower and equipment on the occupying forces, exhausting the combat potential of the enemy. Yesterday, aviation and missile forces and artillery of the Defense Forces made eight strikes on areas of concentration of personnel and military equipment of the enemy, two radars and two other important objects of the occupiers. Title: Our anti-aircraft defense shot down 34 martyrs, two more returned to Russia
Description: The Air Force of the Armed Forces of Ukraine reported this. The enemy's air attack was repulsed by: aviation, anti-aircraft missile forces, mobile fire groups and EW units of the Air Force and the Defense Forces of Ukraine. As a result of the anti-aircraft battle, 34 attack UAVs were shot down. In addition, as a result of the active countermeasures of the EW means of the Defense Forces, twelve UAVs were lost in location in several regions of Ukraine (information about casualties and destruction was not received). Two more enemy attack drones have returned to Russia. Anti-aircraft defense worked in Mykolaiv, Kherson, Sumy, Poltava and Kharkiv regions. As reported by ArmyInform, in a day at the front, the Russian invaders lost 1,020 personnel killed and wounded.

It is noted that the Russian aggressor carried out airstrikes, in particular in the areas of Shalygine, Nova Sloboda, Richki, Novomykolaivka, Pisarivka, Vovchansk, Kupyansk, Petropavlivka, Kucherivka, Radkivka, Novoyehorivka, Chasiv Yar, Shcherbynivka, Pokrovsk, Mykhailivka, Mirnograd, Oleksandropil , Bogoyavlenka, Novodonetske, Urozhaine, Ugledar, Novooleksandrivka, Ukrainka and Shevchenkivka. In the Kharkiv direction two combat clashes took place in the area of ​​the settlement of Vovchansk. In the Kupyan direction, the number of enemy attacks per day reached 11. Defense forces repelled enemy assaults near Novoosynovo, Sinkivka, and Lozova. In the Lyman direction, the enemy carried out 21 assaults near Grekivka, Druzhelyubivka, Makiivka, Nevsky, Novosadovo, Belogorivka, and in Serebryansk Forestry. In the Seversky direction, Ukrainian defenders repelled three attacks by Russian invaders near Ivano-Daryivka and Pereizny. In the Kramatorsk direction, the occupiers attacked six times in the areas of Vasyukivka and Chasovoy Yar. In the direction of Toretsk the enemy, supported by aviation, carried out 19 attacks near Nelipivka, Druzhba, Toretsk and Zalizny. In the Pokrovsky direction our defenders stopped 40 attacks of the aggressor. The Russian occupiers were most active near Vozdvizhenka, Grodivka, Novogrodivka, Marynivka, and Krasny Yar. The greatest concentration of enemy attacks was recorded near Grodivka and Novogrodivka. In the Kurakhiv direction Defense forces repelled 42 attacks near Ukrasnya, Tsukurino, Zhelany Pershy, Georgiyivka, Kostyantynivka, and Katerynivka. In the Vremivsk direction the enemy launched seven attacks in the direction of Vugledar, Katerynivka, Vodyanyi and Kostyantynivka. In the Orikhov direction, one assault on our positions in the Robotyno area was recorded. In the Dnieper direction the enemy conducted five unsuccessful assaults. In the Volyn and Poliske directions no signs of the formation of enemy offensive groups were detected. The operation is ongoing in the Kursk region. We will remind you that last The loss of the Russian invaders amounted to 1,020 people. Ukrainian soldiers also destroyed two tanks, six armored fighting vehicles, six artillery systems, one anti-aircraft missile system, 66 operational-tactical UAVs, 27 vehicles and a unit of special equipment of the occupiers.

In addition, 81 UAVs of various modifications attacked Magdalinivka, Yasynuvate, Gulyapole, Novoandriivka, Novodanilivka, Robotine, Mala Tokmachka, Malinivka, and Poltavka. -17 shellings of MLRS covered Robotyne, Gulyaipole, Novoandriivka and Novodanylivka,- he said. Civilians were not harmed,- noted Ivan Fedorov. As reported by ArmyInform, the occupiers carried out an airstrike on Bogodukhov, two injured.

Title: A cavalcade of diplomats to China, the Taliban and why the collapse of the Russian Federation: an ex...
Description: These questions were answered by military expert Petro Chernyk. — The process of finding a formula for exiting this phase has begun. The most striking sign and argument for this is the so-called summit in Switzerland. A lot of countries gathered there, they simply wouldn't have gathered if they didn't understand some logic of the development of events, says the expert. And he notes that this process cannot be fast: - I really like historical parallels. Let's say the Americans have been negotiating with the Taliban for more than a year. Agreed, but it lasted over a year! This is despite the fact that the stakes in Ukraine and the US stakes with the Taliban are completely out of proportion. Chernyk calls the huge cavalcade of diplomats from Europe to China a second serious sign that the process of finding a way out of this war has begun. — And most importantly, Lavrov recently made a series of statements that they do not need foreign territories, that they are fighting for some Russian people who speak Russian, for the so-called Russian peace. But could there be a trap (in possible negotiations. — Ed.)? Maybe, says a military expert. And he notes that history knows many similar cases: - The brightest, the closest to us, is the Cyprus problem of 1974. Then the Turks invaded Cyprus, formed their own republic, which no one recognizes. And two large countries, primarily the United States and Great Britain, resolved this issue. But the conflict was not resolved by itself, there is no solution to it until now. Can something similar happen with the Ukrainian issue? According to Petr Chernyk, maybe. — I really don't like the word -freeze- because our conflict cannot be frozen for such a long time. There is a high probability that some new demarcation formula will be found. Of course, no one recognizes those territories in the civilized world. A large international contingent is also possible. Why not? It is only important that there are not many Russian proxies there, because they are, say, on the African or Latin American continents, the military expert emphasizes. According to him, in the future, as soon as Russia enters a breathing mode, sanctions may be partially lifted from it, and the possibility of the next Russian-Ukrainian war is only a matter of time: - But again, there is one more very important nuance. This is dangerous and not the best scenario for us, but the Russians have not achieved the most important goal. They did not liquidate Ukrainian statehood. Ukrainian state to be… And we will truly calm down only when the Russian Federation breaks up into 25-30 states, their nuclear weapons are taken away, they are cut off from free resources in Siberia, and the population that will remain around Moscow undergoes the so-called sanitization - ideological cleansing. The same as the Nazis went through after World War II. Chernyk names our further accession to NATO or the formation of a direct military alliance with the USA as an option. — If this does not happen, even if we find a very acceptable formula for us, then the issue of the Russian-Ukrainian war will only be a matter of time. As Bolshevik Lenin said: -Losing Ukraine is like losing your head.-

Title: How reports are prepared at OTU -Kharkiv-: about Telegram, news reports from the front line and the ...
Description: The modern war of Russia against the Ukrainian people and the state of Ukraine is sometimes called the most documented and represented in the media in the history of mankind. Media coverage of hostilities plays a colossal role in shaping public opinion about the war in Ukraine and abroad, and influences public attitudes and policies of foreign partners. ArmiyaInform spoke with Colonel Vitaly Sarantsev, spokesman for the operational-tactical group -Kharkiv-, about the information component of modern warfare. The first part of the interview: Kharkivshchyna as a friend of Syria: the spokesman of the OTU -Kharkiv- called the most despicable purpose of the application KABs. — On the Telegram channels of Ukrainian units and individual military units, and following them in the Ukrainian media, videos are often shared not only of destroyed equipment or positions of the occupiers, but also of liquidated enemy personnel. On the one hand, this is a demonstration of the effectiveness of the combat work of the defenders of Ukraine. On the other hand, there are accusations about the inhumanity of the distribution of such videos, and in some cases they even try to talk about violations of international law, laws and customs of war. How justified are such criticisms of the Ukrainian military? Can the published video recordings be used against the Defense Forces of Ukraine? - Several main points should be taken into account here in order to maintain a very shaky balance between the appropriateness of placing this or that publication and the impropriety, so to speak. On the one hand, the video that demonstrates the effectiveness of our defenders is a kind of message to society that the army is fighting and winning. This is also a kind of report to our citizens who help the Defense Forces with donations. Also, these videos show the average Russian occupier that he could be the next victim. At the same time, posting on information resources video clips depicting the bodies of the dead or the suffering of the wounded may be considered a violation of international humanitarian law, in particular, norms on respect for human dignity or rules for treating the wounded. Everyone who is involved in the work in the information sphere, be it television, news sites, or channels in social networks, has a special responsibility for how they talk about war, because the constant promotion of such content can lead to the desensitization and normalization of violence in society. It should be remembered that every word, every photo, every video frame has weight, especially in wartime. Before disseminating any information, the media person should be aware of its potential consequences. Can it be used by the enemy and how? Will it harm the morale of our defenders? Will it cause panic among civilians? We must be responsible for every word, because not only our reputation, but also the fate of the country depends on it. — I agree, but sometimes one gets the impression that accusations of inhumanity or violations of international law against the Ukrainian military are excessively scrutinizing, especially against the background of what the Russian occupiers openly indulge in and brag about — murders, torture, indiscriminate shelling, or even special targeting destruction of residential buildings, educational and medical facilities, energy facilities etc. One gets the impression that the aggressor is allowed to do everything - he and the aggressor, his crimes have already become a general characteristic of the occupier, and therefore no one is interested. Whereas Ukrainians are forced to fight -in white gloves- - there is such meticulous, increased attention to us. - Indeed, a certain cognitive disparity is visible: on the one hand, we feel the war crimes of the Russian Federation, which has already become the norm for everything of the world, and on the other hand, increased demands are being made to Ukraine regarding compliance with international humanitarian law. For many, this gives rise to a sense of injustice and double standards. But it should be remembered that one of the rules of International Humanitarian Law is non-reciprocity or non-response to wrongful actions of the enemy. This means that respect for the laws of war does not depend on the actions of an enemy who does or does not follow the same rules. The laws of war must be respected at all times, regardless of the actions of the enemy. That is, if the Russians shelled Okhmatdyt, it does not mean that we have the right to shell some children's hospital in the Russian Federation. The rule -an eye for an eye- does not apply here. Therefore, our task is to spread true information about the war and the crimes of the Russian Federation, involve foreign media, involve international organizations in the investigation of these war crimes. In any case, we must adhere to international humanitarian law, even in spite of provocations by the enemy, because, among other things, this is also an important factor in obtaining international support, including military aid. - One more related question. The Armed Forces of Ukraine are hitting enemy positions, including across the border, on Russian territory. But sometimes we get the impression that our territory is being hit regularly, constantly, a lot, and we do not strike back or hit very little, because we were forbidden by the Western allies, we were not given ammunition, etc. Is it even necessary to talk about the fact that the armed forces are also inflicting fire damage on the territory of the Russian Federation? - The enemy must be destroyed wherever he is. Russia has attacked us and is waging an aggressive war of aggression under a fictitious pretext. the Russians seek to destroy the Ukrainian state and the Ukrainian people. We know how cruel the enemy is in his actions, without any moral and ethical restraints. Therefore, it should be destroyed, in particular, on its own territory. According to international law, every state has the right to self-defense. Russia is the aggressor and is fully responsible for all the destruction and casualties on both sides. And of course we have to talk about it. — Quite often, Ukrainian media disseminate information about the situation at the front with an appeal to foreign sources, which are perceived as more authoritative and reliable than Ukrainian ones. For example, reports citing the daily reports of the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) as a primary source have become very popular since the beginning of the large-scale invasion. At the same time, it is not difficult to notice that in many cases the institute's report is reduced to a simple recording and transfer of information from open sources, including official data of the Defense Forces of Ukraine — operational information regarding the Russian invasion of the General Staff of the Armed Forces, information messages of operational-strategic and operational-tactical groups troops, speeches of officially authorized spokespeople, etc. Why is this happening, why do our media people often cite ISW as a primary source even where the institute's report simply repeats official reports? - The Institute for the Study of War is an authoritative resource that analyzes the situation based on open data. However, its reports are often based on a large amount of information from different sources, which may change or be incomplete. At the same time, ISW does not distinguish between official and unofficial sources and very often uses propagandistic Russian materials in its analysis. To the credit of its analysts, they always cite the sources of information, providing a list of everything they used in the preparation of the report. But some of our media probably need to be scolded in this matter, because they perceive the information reported by the Institute as a given. For some reason, it is believed that if certain information is published by ISW, then it means that it has real confirmation and acquires official status. As a result, they sometimes present society with a distorted picture of events. I believe that this is unacceptable. In addition, it undermines our work, the work of the official communication channels of the military-political leadership of the state, the work of communicators of the Armed Forces and the Defense Forces in general. We are conducting a defense operation in which every action, including public information, must be subordinated to the interests of defense. Using unverified information, even from such a powerful resource as the Institute for the Study of War, can unwittingly play along with the enemy. - Can you open the veil of secrecy a little, how a regular daily information message is prepared in Kharkiv OTU? - During the day, we receive information from the areas of the front, from all the brigades that perform combat tasks in our operational-tactical group . Of course, we also work in units during trips. We work with data provided by intelligence. It should be taken into account that the war is very dynamic, the course of hostilities is very fluid. Therefore, in order not to harm our troops, certain information, of course, does not go to the general public, but we organize other information into a daily summary. We may provide some information with a delay, for example, it refers to those moments when we have made some progress or reached new milestones. — And do you take information from any Russian propaganda resources? Do you monitor them? - Of course. Monitoring of the information space, including that of the enemy, continues around the clock. We intercept all information related to the course of hostilities. We, of course, analyze how the enemy presents news and what he talks about. Now we can conclude that the depopulation of Ukrainians — and not only the military, but also civilians — on Russian propaganda resources has reached the point where calls for the total genocide of the entire Ukrainian people are already being presented as something completely commonplace and something that should not arouse in Russians no objections. -Nazis- for Ukrainians is perhaps the most moderate option, there are many much worse ones. The use of such radical images not only incites hatred, but also creates a hostile atmosphere that makes genocidal actions against Ukrainians acceptable in the eyes of Russian society. — But these media can be read by Ukrainian media professionals and ordinary readers. What advice would you give them when they accidentally or purposefully go to an enemy resource? How to work with the information received from there? - The most important thing is that you don't have to go there at all. There are many interesting and useful information resources, both domestic and foreign. Russian ones do not belong to them. But if you still got there, then I advise you not to fall into -betrayal-, because the entire information module on Russian propaganda resources is built in such a way that it can cause panic in an unprepared reader. It should be understood that these channels are propaganda, that they present a distorted reality, and it will be very difficult for an untrained reader to read this or that information. In general, it is important to maintain critical thinking and observe certain rules of safety and media hygiene. —Most of the Russian propaganda resources available to the Ukrainian reader work on the Telegram platform. Since the beginning of the large-scale war, there has even been a certain phenomenon of the so-called Zyu-voenkors, who, of course, are not any military correspondents, but act purely as propagandists of the aggressive war of the Russian Federation against Ukraine, providing its media support. Telegram is very popular in Ukraine, but it has a lot of frankly manipulative channels and hostile propaganda, so it is increasingly believed that it can be dangerous for the national security of Ukraine. So what to do with Telegram in Ukraine? - In my opinion, we should not abandon Telegram or ban it. Banning such platforms may resemble the actions of authoritarian regimes, where control over information is used to suppress dissent. However, its status needs to be determined. Is it messenger or media? If it is a media, then its activities must comply with Ukrainian legislation that regulates the media sector. This means that it must comply with requirements regarding the reliability of information, countering propaganda and protecting national security. This issue needs to be clearly defined at the legislative level to avoid abuse and to ensure both freedom of speech and safety. In addition, a clear definition of the status will make it possible to establish who is responsible for the content that is distributed through Telegram channels. In general, in matters of the functioning of not only Telegram, but also social networks, Ukraine should -show its teeth- more often. We must have strong legislation and tools to monitor, regulate and, if necessary, control platforms that can be used to undermine our country's sovereignty or spread harmful information. —You mentioned the Kursk region, and in continuation of the information topic, I also want to ask about the Russian prisoners of war who were captured by the Defense Forces. It is noticeable that Russian propaganda has strengthened allegations that Ukrainians treat prisoners cruelly, on the one hand, and is trying to increase hatred of the Russian military among Ukrainians, on the other. - This is true. The case with the 155th Marine Corps Brigade of the Russian Federation, when they set the head of a Ukrainian soldier on a stake and bragged about it on video, proves just that. Of course, this provoked quite outrageous comments on social networks, with calls for the same treatment of Russian prisoners. The propagandists of the Russian Federation collect all these posts (made, in particular, not by Ukrainians themselves, but by Russian bots) and use them for information and propaganda work both among civilians and among the Russian military. In this way, they show, they say, this is what will happen to those who surrender to captivity. Such work with the Russian military has certain fruits - some of them prefer to self-destruct - shoot themselves, blow themselves up with a grenade or even strangle themselves with an Esmarch tourniquet - than surrender to captivity. - But at the same time, there are reports in the Ukrainian media from brigades about how wounded Russian servicemen surrender as prisoners - Yes, this happens, and it has been happening, in particular, in our direction, since May more than 50 Russian occupiers surrendered as prisoners. Among the vivid cases, there was a report from the -Charter- brigade about how Ukrainian fighters, with the help of a drone, threw water and a note with instructions on how to surrender to a wounded Russian to a wounded Russian. Then he was taken to Ukrainian positions by drone, and everything was fine with him. In general, Ukrainians treat prisoners in a civilized manner, this cannot even be compared with the conditions in which our prisoners of war in the Russian Federation find themselves - it is enough to compare the appearance of prisoners during exchanges. —In fact, sometimes it is very surprising when Russian propagandists and Russian users of social networks are outraged by reports about the rescue of Russian soldiers, about the fact that they are being taken prisoner. Why does it cause such hatred in them that the Ukrainians saved their military man? - Here, probably, it is a matter of their mentality as a whole. Heroic death is cultivated in Russia. This goes back at least since World War II. A prime example is Stalin's infamous Order No. 227 -let's take a step back.- Surrender is considered something shameful, if a person surrendered even wounded and unable to continue fighting, they still consider him a traitor and a criminal, even his closest relatives disown him very often. This attitude towards prisoners in Russian society also prompts their soldiers to die or lay hands on themselves, but not to surrender. The Russian command constantly warms this attitude. It is in our Kharkiv direction that cases are known when the commanders of the occupiers read order No. 227 in front of the formation, using it as an additional motivational tool. This, by the way, shows that the Russians identify the events of the Second World War with the events that are happening now. They believe that they are continuing the heroic struggle against fascism and Nazism, etc. They connect all this into a single whole with modern events. This simplifies the perception of the conflict by Russians, because they are forced to believe that Ukraine is not a victim of aggression, but a continuation of the same -fascism- that their grandfathers fought against. The very reports about our humane treatment of Russian prisoners destroy the image of bloodthirsty -Nazis- they created for Ukrainians. When it turns out that this is not true, it makes them extremely angry. This breaks the picture that Russian propagandists have been creating for their fellow citizens for decades about Ukraine and Ukrainians. — In your opinion, do the Ukrainian media cope with keeping the propaganda blow from the Russian Federation and at the same time competently informing the Ukrainian society? Do we win this war information or do we lose more? On the one hand, most Ukrainian media resist the flow of misinformation by the Russian Federation. For example, factual initiatives and independent journalistic projects significantly reduce the impact of Russian narratives within the country and beyond. It is also worth noting a certain increase in the level of media literacy of Ukrainian citizens. On the other hand, Russian propaganda, which has huge financial resources and media platforms, continues to be a threat, especially at the international level. As for the question of whether we win the information war, the answer is difficult. In many aspects, Ukraine has won important victories, in particular in shaping a positive international image and coverage of the truth about Russian aggression. However, Russian propaganda still affects certain audiences, especially in the west and in countries where Russian media have a strong position, so we all have a lot of work. By the way, literally it became known that the USA, Canada and the United Kingdom have launched a joint diplomatic campaign against sources of Russian influence in the world. In addition, the United States has imposed sanctions on the Russian propaganda channel of Russia Today and one of the main mouthpieces of the Kremlin Dmitry Kiselev. You can only congratulate these decisions, as this is another step towards our victory.

Title: the Russian IPSO attacks: why does the enemy lie about payments for the status of a child of war
Description: Yes, since the beginning of September, a video has been circulating there, which talks about the alleged entry into force of the new law No. 4995 on the status of -children of war-, according to which from September 1, 2024, children will receive 15 thousand hryvnias each month for three years. The video shows the website of the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine and screenshots from the Diya portal about the status of a child of war. The service identifier is 01199. In fact, this information is not true, it is distributed with the aim of misleading the public and increasing the degree of social tension in our state. Law No. 4995, which is referred to in video, was adopted back in 2017 and concerns the provision of housing for families of fallen ATO soldiers. In addition, according to with the service identifier 01199, it is indeed possible to obtain the status of -child of war-, but this only applies to persons who are citizens of Ukraine and who were less than 18 years old at the time of the end of the Second World War (September 2, 1945). State Propaganda Russia's apparatus uses TikTok to broadcast Kremlin narratives, spread disinformation, and IPSO. At the beginning of 2024, the social network even introduced restrictions on the distribution of content from the accounts of Russian propagandists. One of the most famous examples of Russian IPSO in TikTok, which is aimed at demoralizing Ukrainian society, are videos with allegedly Ukrainian military personnel and demotivating comments in them. . Text messages or a voiceover blame the Ukrainian authorities for all problems, not the Russian Federation, which is waging a terrorist war against our country. In this way, the enemy is trying to create a split within the society. In some cases, the Russians decorate real Ukrainian videos from the front in their own way, in others they try to pretend that they are showing servicemen of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, applying stickers in the form of chevrons, etc. The peak of the next wave of distribution of such videos coincided with the beginning of the mobilization campaign, so their goal was and remains the disruption of mobilization. Research shows that almost 20% of search results on TikTok contain fake or information that misleads users. Because of this, several countries around the world have already taken the initiative to ban this social network.

Title: Two in one: Poland has developed the newest UAV — a scout that can be an artilleryman
Description: As claim the developers of the aircraft from the Polish company WB Electronics, this UAV significantly expands the user's situational awareness, while giving him the ability to safely observe rapidly changing situations on the battlefield or in other environments, ArmyInform reports. One of the main features of X-FRONTER is the use of a military-grade encrypted communication line to control it. This technology provides stable communication protected from jamming attempts, which allows the drone to effectively perform reconnaissance and strike missions at a distance of several kilometers from the operator. With this level of protection, infantry units can rely on the X-FRONTER to conduct surveillance and precision attacks in difficult combat environments. The X-FRONTER is capable of carrying a small explosive payload, including thermobaric, fragmentation, and cluster warheads. This ability makes it not only a reconnaissance tool, but also an effective means of inflicting point strikes on the enemy. In addition, the design of the drone allows it to be easily adapted for different missions, including additional modules such as: infrared markers, devices for installing smoke curtains and other technical innovations. Another important technology implemented in X-FRONTER is the capability for swarm operations. This drone can work in a group with other drones, dividing tasks among themselves. For example, several X-FRONTERs can perform reconnaissance, while other drones equipped with explosives act as mobile artillery, striking the enemy. This greatly expands the tactical capabilities of infantry on the battlefield. The design of the drone from the Polish manufacturer in the folded state resembles a PET bottle in size and shape, which allows you to easily carry it with you. The drone is capable of reaching a speed of up to 60 kilometers per hour and a height of up to 300 meters. In the unfolded state, the X-FRONTER is quite a classic quadcopter, that is, a four-rotor aircraft with symmetrically located -shoulders- around a cylindrical fuselage. Its -hands- with stationary engines and propellers are hidden right in the hull, thanks to which both transportation and preparation for flight take place quickly and without problems, and the absence of protruding elements prevents them from being damaged during transportation. Flight time is up to 40 minutes, which gives infantry units considerable operational flexibility. This flight duration allows the drone to perform long missions, providing reliable support to troops in various situations. X-FRONTER is a versatile tool that can significantly increase the combat capabilities of infantry units. Thanks to its compact size, high mobility, encrypted communication and the ability to operate in swarms, this drone becomes indispensable for a wide range of tasks on the battlefield. The Polish developer presented a new compact and deadly X-FRONTER infantry drone. Video: Main Battle Tank

Title: The Defense Forces spoke about the tactics of the Russians in the Lymano-Kupian direction
Description: Officer Andrii Otchenash, commander of the Kara Nebesna UAV crew of the Rubizh brigade, told about this on the broadcast of the Yedyny Novyni telethon. According to him, the enemy moves mainly by infantry, and much less often by vehicles. -They use a huge number of personnel. In some places, technology is used, but not as brightly as it was before. They understand that as soon as they use a large amount of equipment, it will be destroyed immediately,- said the officer. He explained that the Russians are trying to move in small groups, accumulate at certain points and carry out further offensive actions. -For example, a group of 10 Russians moves, four arrive. They hide in dugouts, where it is more difficult to get them. Next comes the next group. They are all waiting to be replenished until they are collected enough for assault actions,- the officer noted. As reported by ArmyInform, today in the Kupyansk direction the enemy ;utm_medium=article&utm_campaign=traficsource->carried out seven assaults near Sinkivka and Lozova. Three skirmishes have ended, four more are ongoing. He added that all steps have been determined that can give Ukraine the strongest possible position to approach a real, just peace. -For each step, there is a clear list of points, what exactly is necessary, what exactly will work for strengthening. There is no impossible thing there. More than 90% of everything is written out. Title: He provided the occupiers with transport and fuel: the director of the agricultural company will be ...
Description: The Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office informed about this. The director of an agricultural enterprise located in the village of Bily Kolodyaz of the Kharkiv Region became an accomplice of the occupiers and handed over to them the automobile equipment of the agricultural company controlled by him and the fuel for it. Since March 2022, the head of the enterprise deliberately established contact with representatives of the aggressor state and handed over the premises of the elevator building along with the equipment and other material assets available at that time to the enemy. In June of the same year, the occupiers appointed a man to the position of -temporary administrator of the Branch of the Joint-Stock Company -Gosudarstvennaya provodlovstvennia zernovaya kompaniya Ukrainy Belokolodezyansky elevator-. The enemy's helper ensured the operation of the enterprise and organized the reception, drying, shipment and temporary storage of agricultural crops. In addition, the accused gave instructions to subordinate employees to refuel motor vehicles that were on the company's balance sheet, which he later also handed over to the armed forces of the aggressor state. An accomplice of the enemy performed his duties until the moment of deoccupation. Currently, he is hiding from Ukrainian law enforcement officers, he is declared wanted. The man will be tried in absentia for aiding the aggressor state. He faces up to twelve years of imprisonment with deprivation of the right to hold certain positions or engage in certain activities for a period of up to fifteen years and confiscation of property. Title: The Russian soldier who shot two residents of Buchi was declared a suspect
Description: This is stated in messages of the National Police. At the end of March 2022, an armed occupier detained a 75-year-old unarmed local resident without reason. Together with the hostage, he broke into the house of another Buchi resident without warning and demanded to give him alcohol and drink with him. The 63-year-old owner replied that he does not drink alcohol. The occupier did not accept the refusal and searched the kitchen, as a result of which he found alcohol, got angry and shot both residents of Buchi with automatic fire. The men died on the spot from their injuries. At that time, the sister and wife of the murdered owner were hiding in the next room and witnessed the murder of their family member and neighbor. They also told the investigators that later the Russian military came to them and buried the body of the owner of the house in the yard, and the body of another man was taken outside the territory of the house - a few weeks later his son found his body covered with leaves. The investigators of the National Police established the identity of the murderer. He is a 26-year-old native of the Altai Territory, a sniper of the 27th separate detachment of special forces -Kuzbass- (military unit 6607, Kemerovo) of the National Guard of the Russian Federation. Under the procedural guidance of the General Prosecutor's Office, he was informed of the suspicion of violating the laws and customs of war, combined with intentional murder (Part 2 of Article 438 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine). He faces life imprisonment for war crimes committed on the territory of Ukraine.

Title: 221 medical facilities were completely destroyed by the occupiers since the large-scale invasion
Description: Sad statistics of losses for 30 months of the war reported in the Ministry of Health of Ukraine. Health care institutions of Kharkiv, Donetsk, Mykolaiv, Kyiv, Chernihiv, Dnipropetrovsk, Kherson and Zaporizhia regions suffered the greatest losses. It is currently impossible to obtain comprehensive information on the extent of the destruction of hospitals in the temporarily occupied territories. 221 medical institutions were completely destroyed and cannot be restored. In addition, the enemy destroyed 261 ambulances, damaged another 202, and captured 125. Despite the systemic circumstances and the burden on the health care system in Ukraine, recovery work has been ongoing since the first months of the full-scale war. For more than two years, 886 medical facilities have been fully and/or partially restored in different regions of Ukraine. Of them, 533 objects have been fully restored and another 353 - partially. These are medical facilities in the de-occupied territories, as well as those that suffered minor damage: broken windows, destruction of the roof, damage to the facade, etc. Most of the facilities were restored in Mykolaiv, Dnipropetrovsk, Kyiv, Kharkiv and Chernihiv regions. Title: The Ministry of Defense allowed a Canadian armored car to be used in the Armed Forces
Description: This was reported by Ministry of Defense of Ukraine. The Canadian-made Roshel Senator MRAP armored vehicle was codified and approved for use in the military by the Ministry of Defense. MRAP armored vehicles (from the English MRAP, Mine Resistant Ambush Protected – protection against mines and ambushes). Such machines have a V-shaped bottom to dissipate the energy of the explosion and special shock-absorbing seats. Structurally, they consist of a monolithic armored capsule and external explosion-absorbing units: wheels, chassis, engine. The latter absorb all the kinetic energy from the mine explosion, preserving the integrity of the residential module. The Roshel Senator armored car is designed on the chassis of the American Ford F-550 heavy pickup truck. Initially, the car was intended for the needs of the police. The model was improved for the needs of the Ukrainian army. The Roshel Senator MRAP received armor capable of protecting the crew and the landing party from bullets fired from small arms and debris. As well as a special V-shaped bottom, which dissipates the energy of a mine explosion or other explosive device equivalent to 6 kg of TNT. In addition, the Canadian armored car received a reinforced chassis, an all-wheel drive mechanism, and a 6.7-liter -omnivorous- turbodiesel with a capacity of more than 300 horsepower. In the configuration for the front, the car must also have a winch and a -night- light. Since the beginning of the large-scale invasion, the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine has codified and approved for service in the army more than 20 armored vehicles of the MRAP class. Manufacturers and developers of OVT samples with additional questions regarding the process of product codification can contact the Main Directorate for Life Cycle Support of Weapons and Military Equipment by e-mail: mdalc@mil.ua

In the Kupyansk direction the enemy carried out seven assaults near Sinkivka and Lozova. Three skirmishes have ended, four more are ongoing. In the Lyman direction, the invading army attacked 18 times near Grekivka, Druzhelyubivka, Makiivka, Nevsky, Novosadovo, Lozova, Bilogorivka, and in the Serebryansk forest. In the Seversky direction during the day, the occupiers unsuccessfully attacked once in the Ivano-Daryivka area. In the Kramatorsk direction the invaders carried out assaults four times. The defense forces are holding back the enemy's onslaught and have repulsed 20 attacks, with four engagements still ongoing. Enemy losses are being refined. In the Vremivsk direction the occupiers attacked the positions of our troops near Vugledar, Katerynivka, Vodyanyi and Kostyantynivka five times. Two enemy assaults have been repulsed, three battles are ongoing. In the Orikhov direction the enemy continues shelling the positions of our troops and civilian infrastructure, carries out airstrikes. On the Dnieper direction, the Russian invaders twice tried to dislodge our units from their positions. They were repulsed and suffered losses. In other areas of the front, the situation has not undergone significant changes. As reported by ArmyInform, in the Kharkiv direction the enemy has reduced activity in some places - the hottest in Vovchansk.

Title: A Russian Kh-101 missile was neutralized in Vinnytsia
Description: About this notified the National Police of Ukraine. The rocket was discovered by farmers in a field near one of the settlements. The fragments of the explosive object scattered over an area of ​​1 hectare, but the warhead still posed a danger to people. Also, during the inspection of the surrounding area, the law enforcement officers found cluster ammunition, which they neutralized on the spot. Employees of the Vinnytsia Oblast explosives service examined the fragments of the rocket, separated the warhead from the remains of the body and detonated the dangerous object in a specially equipped place. The police reminded that if any suspicious objects are found, it is not allowed to approach and touch them. It is necessary to report the find to the emergency services immediately.

Title: Minors who set fire to military vehicles were detained in Kyiv and Donetsk region
Description: This is stated in message of the SBU. The attackers -hunted- for SUVs of the Armed Forces, equipped for combat missions on the front line. First, those involved would find potential targets and coordinate them with their Russian handlers. Then they arrived at the parking lots of military vehicles and set them on fire with gasoline and flammable mixtures. For a -report- to the occupiers, those involved filmed the fire on their phone cameras, hoping for -easy money.- However, none of the arsonists did not wait for the promised money from the Rashists. A 16-year-old suspect who came from Cherkasy region to set fire to military vehicles in the capital was detained in Kyiv. For the -test- task, the young man had to burn an SUV that volunteers had purchased for one of the combat brigades of the Armed Forces of Ukraine fighting on the Eastern Front. In Donetsk region, a resident of Kramatorsk was detained, who also wanted to -make money- by setting fire to cars of the Defense Forces. Immediately, after the first attempt to destroy the Ukrainian soldier's SUV, the Security Service detained the young man and seized incendiary devices from him. Currently, both persons involved have been notified of suspicion under Part 1 of Art. 114-1 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (obstructing the legitimate activities of the Armed Forces and other military formations during a special period). Despite their young age, the detainees face up to 8 years in prison.

Title: Today we ride in comfortable medevacs, and tomorrow we can sail in boats - Scout Ever
Description: About inform September 16 at the Main Intelligence Directorate of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine. And only after that we begin to determine our own evacuation points, the points of work of medevacs, casevacs and send people to the field,- Ever explained. Legion medics are able to work in different conditions - it all depends on the combat mission. -Today we can ride, for example, on comfortable medevacs, and tomorrow we can sail on boats, make evacuations using ATVs,- the scout noted. Title: The defense forces received 18 self-propelled guns -Bohdan-, the production of which was financed by...
