Title: Dmytro Klimenkov: Denmark's investment in our defense industry is the key to strengthening Ukraine's...
Description: About this notified IOU The meeting discussed new opportunities for the development of the Ukrainian defense industry and further steps to strengthen Ukraine's defense capabilities in the face of a full-scale war. -Ukraine is sincerely grateful to Denmark for its steadfast support during an extremely difficult time for our country. The investments that Denmark directs to the development of the Ukrainian defense industry and the modernization of military capabilities are of great importance to us,- emphasized Dmytro Klimenkov. Denmark became the first country to invest in the Ukrainian defense industry, launching a unique form of cooperation known as the -Danish Model-. This model provides for direct financing of the production of Ukrainian military equipment in the amount of more than 50 million euros. Ukraine has already received the first samples of artillery, the production of which was financed by Denmark. This approach allows Ukraine to strengthen its defense capabilities and develop its own production capacity, even in wartime conditions. -The meeting once again confirmed the importance of international cooperation and solidarity in countering Russian aggression. The parties expressed their readiness to continue joint efforts to increase Ukraine's defense capabilities,- the Ministry of Defense said.

Title: They pretended to be public activists and called for a coup: 50 people were detained

The perpetrators publicly called for a violent seizure of state power in Ukraine in order to support the armed aggression of the Russian Federation -from the inside,- the report says. Thanks to the Security Service of Ukraine, more than 30 of them have been reported on suspicion of crimes against national security. Another 14 defendants received actual prison terms and are currently serving their sentences. Thus, in Dnipro Oblast, law enforcement officers neutralized the subversive activities of the head of a pro-Kremlin cell and eight of his accomplices. In Zaporizhzhia, five fake -people's power- bloggers were exposed, who, at the behest of the occupiers, were spreading misinformation about the activities of TCC employees. -To carry out information sabotage, the perpetrators used their own Telegram and YouTube channels, through which they made mass -throwbacks- against Ukrainian servicemen,- the SBU noted. Two enemy accomplices who organized video conferences with Russian propagandists and racist ideologues were convicted in Khmelnytskyi. During such online bridges, the participants called for the seizure of power in Kyiv with the subsequent -joining- of Ukraine to the Russian Federation. As a result of anti-aircraft combat, 53 enemy attack UAVs were shot down in the Kyiv, Cherkasy, Vinnytsia, Poltava, Sumy, Zaporizhzhya, Kirovohrad, Mykolaiv, Dnipropetrovsk, and Cherkasy regions. Three more enemy drones were lost in location in several regions, previously without casualties or consequences.

Title: The chiefs of general staffs of NATO countries discussed strengthening support for Ukraine
Description: This is stated in a message on the NATO website. The military leaders of the Alliance countries discussed the creation of a new NATO command for security assistance and training for Ukraine. The new structure will allow NATO to supervise the training of the Ukrainian Armed Forces at training bases in the Alliance countries, support Ukraine through aid planning and coordination, manage the transfer and repair of equipment and provide support for the long-term development of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. -Every day we are becoming more and more compatible. Until the day when we stand side by side under the NATO flag. Ukraine deserves our unceasing support,- said Admiral Rob Bauer, Chairman of the NATO Military Committee. Among other topics, the chiefs of the General Staff discussed the creation of the NATO Initiative for Security Assistance and Training for Ukraine and the launch of -nato-ukrayina-jatec-minoborony/->Joint NATO-Ukraine Analysis, Training and Education Center (JATEC).

Title: The pseudo-governor of the Kherson region was sentenced to 15 years in prison
Description: The Prosecutor General's Office reported this. The verdict of the court of the so-called governor of the Kherson region, who at that time was the head of the Kherson occupation military-civilian administration, sentenced him to 15 years of imprisonment. The other six members of the organized group were sentenced to 10 to 15 years in prison with confiscation of property. Prosecutors proved in court that the convicts went over to the side of the enemy in the temporarily occupied territories of the Kherson region and actively assisted the occupation authorities of the Russian Federation in providing postal, logistical, financial and trade needs. On the basis of integral property complexes of the Kherson directorate of JSC -Ukrposhta-, they created and ensured the operation of a pseudo-structure - the -state unitary enterprise -Kherson Post-. The convicts campaigned for the employees of JSC -Ukrposhta- to get a job before the illegal establishment, assuring them that the Russian occupation authorities would be there forever. As reported by ArmyInform, law enforcement officers detained an Odessa citizen who was scouting locations of Ukrainian military and defense enterprises in the region. The attacker was preparing coordinates for a new series of missile and drone strikes on Odesa.

Title: The hottest in Vovchansk: in the Kharkiv direction, the enemy has reduced activity in some places
Description: Vitaliy Sarantsev, the spokesman of OTU -Kharkiv-, told about this on the air of the national telethon -Yedini Novyni- . — As of today, the hottest part of the front is the Vovchan direction. This is directly the city of Vovchansk and the settlements adjacent to it. There, the enemy continues to attack the city, conduct street battles. There, he continues to try to wedge himself into the depth of our defense systems and inflict fire damage using a variety of weapons, he said. However, the occupiers face persistent resistance from units of the Defense Forces of Ukraine, which inflict losses on the enemy and force him to abandon his tasks. Thanks to the successful actions of the Ukrainian defenders, the Russian invaders were forced to reduce their activity and refuse to carry out assault actions in separate areas in the north of Kharkiv region. — If we take other directions, in particular, Staritsa, Liptsi, Hlyboke, Lukyantsi, the enemy is not currently conducting any active actions there. But this does not mean that he left and gave up the offensive. No, he is building up his forces, he is conducting an internal rotation of units. Where it is possible, he is trying to carry out logistical support measures, build up the communication system, build up the management system. This is evidence that he is still preparing to carry out offensive actions in certain directions with the aim of restoring the lost position, the spokesman noted. He emphasized that the Defense Forces, under favorable conditions, are trying to advance and advance, and also regularly inflict effective fire damage on the occupiers. — We are improving our own tactical position and little by little we are liberating our land from the Russian occupiers, Vitaly Sarantsev concluded. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that Vovchansk is under fire control, the occupiers trying to establish themselves mainly in the surrounding forests, instead in the city itself, the Russians shelled with RSZV own subdivisions in the area of ​​Aggregate Plant.

Title: Financed the production of arms of the Russian Federation through a business partner from Moscow: a ...
Description: The Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office informed about this on September 16. According to the investigation, after the full-scale invasion of the Russian Federation into the territory of Ukraine, the director of one of the Kharkiv private enterprises continued to do business with a Russian company, in defiance of legal prohibitions. The entrepreneur continued to work with her business partner from Moscow. -Understanding that she will not be able to transfer the money to him, the accused engaged intermediaries. They became her acquaintances from the temporarily occupied territories, who can conduct financial transactions in the Russian Federation without hindrance,- the message says. In the period from May 2022 to April 2024, the woman sent money to their cards, and they were already able to transfer money directly to the partner's account in Moscow. ” The businesswoman's companion uses this money to pay taxes to the Russian budget, thereby ensuring the constant functioning of the military-industrial complex enterprise, primarily the missiles with which the enemy systematically fires at our state, law enforcement officers said. The Slobid district prosecutor's office of the city of Kharkiv approved and sent to the court an indictment against the 50-year-old director of a private enterprise for financing actions taken with the aim of changing the borders of the territory and the state border of Ukraine in violation of the order established by the Constitution of Ukraine, based on a prior conspiracy by a group of persons (part 3 of Article 110-2 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine). The accused faces up to eight years of imprisonment with deprivation of the right to hold certain positions or engage in certain activities for a period of up to three years and confiscation of property. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that banker-spy was detained in Kharkiv.

Title: The enemy army lost more than 960 occupiers, special equipment and tanks in the East
Description: informs operational and strategic grouping of troops -Khortytsia-. The total losses of the Russian army in the area of ​​responsibility of the -Khortytsia- anti-aircraft missile defense system as of September 15, 2024 are: -The defense forces continue to actively inflict losses on the enemy's troops in manpower and equipment, exhaust the enemy along the entire line of combat engagement,- the message says. As reported by ArmyInform, last day losses of the Russian invaders amounted to 1060 people. Also, Ukrainian soldiers destroyed 3 tanks, 8 armored combat vehicles, 14 artillery systems, one MLRS, 29 UAVs of operational-tactical level, 28 cars and 6 units of special equipment of the occupiers.

Title: Strengthened by 40%: the enemy intensified aerial reconnaissance in the Kharkiv region
Description: The enemy's goal was explained on the air of the national telethon -Edyny Novyny- the spokesman of the OTU -Kharkiv- Vitaly Sarantsev. - Enemy air reconnaissance increased by about 40%. He spends her both day and night. It should be noted that the adversary can thereby fulfill two purposes. The first is the identification of units of the Defense Forces with the subsequent task of fire damage on positions and our forces and assets. The second issue is reconnaissance of movement routes for own units. He monitors this or that area and tries to draw up an optimal route for moving both personnel and equipment, he said. Another task of enemy air reconnaissance is to find routes for safe movement in the nearest enemy rear for the purpose of establishing logistics. — He is trying to find new routes for logistical support activities. Because our FPV drones do not allow us to live peacefully, do not allow us to move peacefully for any purpose - whether for assaults or for delivering provisions or ammunition to advanced positions, the spokesman said. Despite this, the Russians are still trying to use equipment for logistical support and personnel transportation. Defense forces effectively counter such attempts. — Yesterday evening, the enemy tried to bring personnel to Vovchansk with the help of vehicles. But the equipment was discovered, it was damaged and it was partially destroyed along with the crew and the landing party that it was carrying to reinforce units in Vovchansk, Vitaliy Sarantsev reported. Earlier, ArmyInform informed that destruction of enemy reconnaissance UAVs long range is one of the keys to reducing the number of anti-aircraft missile strikes on Ukrainian territory, and also reported that in the area of ​​Aggregatny Zavod in Vovchansk, the enemy hit their own units with anti-aircraft missiles.

Title: The Ministry of Defense implements Euro-Atlantic management standards: specialists have completed jo...
Description: About this inform September 16 in the MoU. Co-governance is a governance model that promotes building strong, coordinated interaction between the civilian leadership of the Ministry and the military command of the Armed Forces of Ukraine on issues of decision-making and policy formation. The IOU emphasized that this approach, successfully applied by EU and NATO countries, contributes to bringing Ukraine closer to Euro-Atlantic standards. To implement the new system, the department initiated training courses for employees and servicemen of the Defense Forces . As part of this program, 71 specialists were successfully trained. The MOU noted that the curriculum covers the study of the role of committees, modern approaches to defense management, issues of policy formation, and economic aspects of governance in wartime and postwar times. -The culmination of the training was the practical task of preparing and holding a joint governance committee meeting,- the message reads. The First Deputy Minister of Defense of Ukraine, Lieutenant General Ivan Gavryliuk emphasized the importance of these training sessions initiatives. -For the successful implementation of joint governance, it is necessary to train specialists who are familiar with the modern principles of management of decision-making and implementation processes in the system of the Ministry of Defense,- he said he. According to him, these courses provide servicemen and employees of the Ministry of Defense with additional knowledge and skills necessary for further reforming the defense sector. Currently, the management structure within the framework of joint governance in the system of the Ministry of Defense consists of from three levels. At the highest level, there is a Strategic Council chaired by the Minister of Defense, which considers the most important issues. The executive level is represented by committees, each of which is responsible for a specific area of ​​activity. The third level includes auxiliary commissions and working groups that provide support for decision-making. Thanks to the implementation of shared governance, the Ministry of Defense has already taken a number of key decisions, including the creation of the Human Capital Policy and the involvement of recruiting agencies for military recruitment. This indicates the readiness of the department's staff to work effectively under the conditions of the new management system and further improvement of decision-making and implementation processes. The curriculum was developed by specialists of the National Defense University of Ukraine, experts of the international PROTECT project 2 and the School of Government of the National University -Ostroh Academy- on the order of the Department of Military Policy and Strategic Planning of the Ministry of Defense. All participants who successfully completed the course received appropriate certificates. As reported by ArmyInform, also gender advisors in the MOU system passed a two-day training on the topic -International humanitarian law and the role of the Defense Forces of Ukraine in its implementation-.

Title: Since the beginning of September, Russia has used more than 640 martyrs against Ukraine - the Presid...
Description: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy announced this on September 16. -Fortunately, most of them were shot down by our soldiers. We are constantly working to make the Ukrainian air shield more effective. We are strengthening our Air Force, mobile fire groups, all air defense units,- the head of state said. The President reminded that this night the Russian army launched 56 -shahedis-, of which 53 were shot down by Ukrainian air defense units. -Our sky defenders have worked effectively in many regions. Thanks for the accuracy to every soldier,- he emphasized. As reported by ArmyInform, during the week the Russians ->used against Ukraine more than 800 guided aerial bombs, about 30 missiles of various types and almost 300 attack drones.

Title: Russian troops shelled Donetsk region 21 times: one person was killed and injured
Description: This was reported by the head of Donetsk OVA Vadym Filashkin. 12 private houses were damaged in Kurakhovo, an administrative building in Myrnohrad, and 15 houses in the Novoekonomichny district of Grodivska hromada. In Pokrovsk, 1 person died and 3 others were injured, 3 infrastructure facilities and a household building were damaged. Also in Liman, as a result of Russian aggression, 2 administrative buildings and a non-residential building were destroyed. In Mykolaivka, the occupiers injured 3 people, damaged 11 high-rise buildings, and a shop. In addition, Russian invaders destroyed 10 houses in Siversk. In the Chasovoyarsk community, the enemy wounded one resident. 423 people, including 98 children, were evacuated from the front line. As reported by ArmyInform, last day, in general, the Russian invaders genshtab-zsu/->inflicted on the territory of Ukraine 56 air strikes, dropping 83 guided aerial bombs. The troops of the Russian Federation were involved in destroying 428 kamikaze drones.

Title: Airfields are more important than carriers: the Armed Forces named the main method of combating KAB ...
Description: On the air of the national telethon -Yedini Novyni- the spokesman of OTU -Kharkiv- Vitaly Sarantsev emphasized this. — First of all, of course, it is the destruction of the carriers of these ammunition. This is the first. And the second, more important, I believe, is the destruction of the airfield infrastructure in the range of the weapons that we are now asking from our partners, he said. Strikes on enemy airfields with long-range weapons from Western partners can significantly change the situation for the better for Ukraine. — Destruction of airfield infrastructure, destruction of airstrips, destruction of warehouses with ammunition, warehouses with PMM — this, of course, would greatly improve our situation and greatly weaken the offensive capabilities of the enemy, he explained in detail. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that the occupiers hit the Kharkiv region with anti-aircraft guns: one person died in the region, 47 were injured.

Title: The invaders went on an assault, but the marines stopped them with one FPV drone
Description: released a video of the combat work on September 16 on its channel Naval Forces of the Ukrainian Armed Forces. -Just one excellent FPV drone in the skillful hands of the pilot of the Gryphon unit of the 501st separate battalion of the marines stopped another attempt to storm our positions by Katsap bastards,- the military said. Previously, ArmyInform showed how drones of the Gryphon UAV unit of the 501st Marine Infantry Battalion of the Armed Forces of Ukraine punisheda large number of army transport Russian Federation for violating traffic rules.

Title: The Armed Forces explained why the Russians do not dare to attack ships in the grain corridor
Description: This was noted by the spokesman of the Navy of Ukraine, Captain 3rd Rank Dmytro Pletenchuk, on the air of the national telethon -Edyny Novyni- . — The incident took place outside our grain corridor, our corridor is operating in a stable mode. Most of it, as you know, passes through the territorial waters of the member countries of the North Atlantic Alliance. Accordingly, the Russians do not dare to do such pranks in these waters, he said. In addition, grain carriers usually sail under foreign flags. Among the leaders who use the services of the Ukrainian grain corridor, China is on the first place and Spain is on the second. — We had a similar case last year. Over time, of course, it will become clear whether this was a targeted attack or not. However, this does not change the fact that the Russians targeted a civilian vessel, regardless of whether it was the result of the irresponsible use of inappropriate weapons or a targeted attack, the spokesman emphasized. Russians hit a civilian ship with wheat from Ukraine for Egypt with the Kh-22 Burya anti-ship missile. - This is a rather outdated type of weapon. It is anti-ship, but given that it was immediately designed for a nuclear warhead, an error of 50 kilometers was not a problem for it. But when it is used with another warhead, it can become a problem for it - not only for it, but also for everyone who is in the radius of flight of this missile, Dmytro Pletenchuk noted. He reminded that this missile should be called -50 for 50- - launched more than 50 years ago, it may not hit the target, deflecting at a distance of more than 50 kilometers. The spokesman also noted that the Russians launched a missile from a Tu-22 strategic aviation bomber. -This shows that the Russians do not dare to come close to our coast using tactical aviation,- he emphasized. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that withdrawal of Russian ships from the port of Novorossiysk is connected with the threat of use of long-range weapons by the Defense Forces of Ukraine, which could hit ships at the base's location.

Title: Army sportsmen won gold at the Baltic Championship in shooting
Description: This was reported to ArmyInform by the Department of Physical Culture and Sports of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine. In the period from September 12 to 15, 2024, the 3rd Baltic Ball Shooting Championship among military personnel was held in Dobele (Latvia) with the participation of seven European countries (Latvia, Lithuania, Estonia, Poland, Sweden, Switzerland and Ukraine). In total, the national team of the Armed Forces of Ukraine won seven medals, including: 2 gold, 2 silver and 3 bronze. In particular, in the air pistol competition, the men's team of the Armed Forces of Ukraine won the gold award, and the women's – became a silver medalist. In the personal competition in this exercise, representatives of the Training and Sports Base of Summer Sports, senior lieutenant Pavlo Korostylov and senior soldier Polina Kolesnikova won silver and bronze medals, respectively. In the sports pistol competition, the men's team of the Armed Forces of Ukraine won the gold award, and the women's – became a bronze medalist. Senior Lieutenant Pavlo Korostylov won another bronze medal for Ukraine in the individual shooting competition for this exercise and was also nominated for the best marksman at the results of the championship. Earlier ArmyInform reported , that an employee of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, Ivanna Berezovska, won two gold medals at the World Sumo Championship.

Title: He spied on mobile air defense groups and the assault brigade -Lyut-: an Odesa citizen was detained
Description: About inform September 16 in the Security Service of Ukraine. It is noted that the priority targets of the enemy were the temporary bases of units of the combined assault brigade of the National Police -Lyut-, which perform tasks on the southern front. Also, the occupiers planned to strike the locations of deployment of mobile air defense fire groups. -In order to obtain geolocations for the attacks, the Russian special service remotely recruited a 63-year-old man from Odessa who agreed to cooperate in exchange for money,- the report said. To carry out enemy tasks, he regularly went around the city, where under the guise of walking, he secretly photographed military objects. -In order to transfer intelligence to the aggressor, the agent used e-mail,- the SBU said. During the search of the detainee's premises, a mobile phone and computer equipment with evidence of criminal activity were seized. -Employees of the SBU documented the intelligence activity of the suspect step by step and arrested him red-handed when he was conducting reconnaissance near a military facility. Additional measures were also taken to secure the bases of Ukrainian troops,- the SBU reported. Investigators of the Security Service informed him of the suspicion under Part 2 of Art. 111 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (treason committed under martial law). The perpetrator is in custody. He faces up to life in prison with forfeiture of property. As reported by ArmyInform, previously the SBU and the National Police detained four more accomplices of the Russian special services who -na-10-rokiv-tyurmy/->committed arson attacks in Odesa. Under the -sight- of the enemy were service minibuses and SUVs of the Defense Forces.

Title: The occupiers hit the Kharkiv region with anti-aircraft guns: one person died in the region, 47 were...
Description: informed Oleg Synegubov, chief of Kharkiv OVA, about the consequences of enemy attacks on Kharkiv Oblast during the past day. Yesterday, around 3:30 p.m., the Russian army struck the Nemyshlyansky district of Kharkov with anti-tank missiles. As a result of the shelling, one person died and another 43 people were injured, including 4 children. 22 apartment buildings and 20 cars were damaged. One of the hits of an aerial bomb hit a 12-story residential building. Also, around 4:00 p.m., the Russian military hit Kupyansk with aerial bombs, 3 KAB hits were recorded in the city and 4 on its northern outskirts. Two women and a man were injured. Later, a car was hit by an FPV drone in Kupyansk. In the Kupyan district, the occupiers also shelled the villages of Senkove and Kurylivka of the Kuriliv community and the village of Kindrashivka of the Kindrashiv community. There, as a result of shelling, residential buildings and farm buildings burned, and fires broke out in ecosystems. In the Izyum district, the villages of Pisky-Radkivski and Shykivka of the Boriv community, and the village of Verbivka of the Balakliya community were hit by crows. A 76-year-old woman was injured in Pisky-Radkivskyi, a warehouse was on fire. In Shyykivka, there was a fire in the ecosystem - grass burned on an area of ​​500 square meters. In Verbivka, as a result of the shelling, two farm buildings and grass on an area of ​​10 hectares burned. In the Kharkiv district, the Russian occupiers shelled Circun of the Tsirkuniv community and Ruska Lozova of the Dergachyv community. Two farm buildings, a defunct store, a defunct gas station and grass on an area of ​​7 hectares burned in Tsirkuny. The invaders fired at a store, a hangar, a metal container and an outbuilding. In Ruska Lozovaya, as a result of shelling, a farm and grass on an area of ​​1 hectare burned. The occupiers also shelled the village of Verkhniy Saltiv of the Starosaltiv community of the Chuguyiv district. A house, an outbuilding and grass on an area of ​​10 hectares burned there. In Bohodukhiv Oblast, as a result of enemy shelling outside the village of Stognii of the Zolochiv community, a fire broke out in the ecosystem - grass burned on an area of ​​10 hectares. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that the army of the Russian Federation bombed Kharkiv, with time became known about an increasing number of victims.

Title: Night bombers illuminate Luhansk region and force the enemy to retreat
Description: released a video of the combat work of the fighters of the rapid response border command post of RUbAK -Fenix- on their channel. -Our UAV operators continue their tireless work of cleaning our native land from the occupation scum,- defenders of Ukraine commented. Previously, ArmyInform showed how fighters from the Guards Brigade of the -Revenge- offensive during one day destroyed 5 motorcycles with occupiers in Donetsk region and Kharkiv region.

Title: The army of the Russian Federation carried out more than 60 shellings in the north of Ukraine
Description: This is reported by the operational command -North-. -As a result of Russian shelling over the past 24 hours, a residential building, farm buildings, agricultural machinery and private transport were destroyed, residential buildings and critical infrastructure were damaged,- the report said. As reported by ArmyInform, yesterday the enemy delivered a missile attack on the positions of Ukrainian units and populated areas with the use of one missile, as well as 77 airstrikes, including dropping 117 anti-aircraft missiles.

Title: According to their own units with anti-aircraft missiles: in Vovchansk, the enemy shelled the area o...
Description: Detailed information about the situation and enemy losses in the Kharkiv direction informed in Kharkiv OTU. In Vovchansk, in the evening in the northern part of the city, the enemy made an attempt to deliver personnel with the use of automobile equipment, which was destroyed as a result of fire damage. Due to the double fire damage - both from the Defense Forces and from their own MLRS - the enemy has suffered casualties, is evacuating the wounded and is trying to establish logistical support. In the area of ​​the settlement Tikhe, he brought personnel to advanced positions, focused the main attention on conducting aerial reconnaissance with the aim of identifying units of the Defense Forces of Ukraine. In the area of ​​the settlement Hlyboke, the enemy is carrying out individual movement of personnel with the aim of replenishing the current shortage in forward positions, conducting engineering reconnaissance of advance routes. It is trying to find new routes for carrying out logistical support measures. Near Lukyantsi, the enemy is expanding the communication system, has carried out logistical support measures. During the past 24 hours, there has been 1 combat encounter. the Russian occupiers also carried out 2 airstrikes using 6 anti-aircraft missiles. The occupiers struck 36 kamikaze drones and fired 372 shots at the positions of the Defense Forces of Ukraine. The defense forces of Ukraine respond adequately to the actions of the enemy and continue to destroy the manpower, weapons and military equipment of the Russian occupiers. Enemy losses over the past day amounted to 85 creatures, of which 22 were irreversible, 61 sanitary. Two occupiers surrendered as prisoners. Also in the Kharkiv direction the enemy lost destroyed and damaged 42 units of weapons and military equipment, in particular: Also in the Kharkiv direction, the Defense Forces destroyed 43 shelters for personnel, a place to store ammunition and 2 launch pads for launching unmanned aerial vehicles. ArmyInform previously explained , which on the occupiers enter their own advanced positions in the north of Kharkiv region only individually and in small groups - the reason is Ukrainian drones.

Title: Our drone destroyed the anti-drone position of the Russians with one hit
Description: They published a video of combat work on their channel. It is noted that the aerial reconnaissance of the 5th Slobozhan Brigade of the NSU detected the positions of the Russian invaders, from which the enemy was conducting anti-drone control of its units. -Given the importance of the target, its coordinates were passed on to our brigade's FPV drone crew. But a decision was made to strike,- the fighters said. According to them, thanks to the professionalism and meticulous work of the Slobozhan crew with the involvement of only one FPV drone, the position of the anti-drone calculation of the Russian invaders was destroyed. Previously, ArmyInform showed how a single kamikaze drone with a cumulative charge accurately hit and destroyed the anti-aircraft missile complex -Tor- of the Russian occupiers, UAV operators of the 5th Slobozhan Brigade of the National Guard of Ukraine.

Title: -From fire to flame-: the Russians made an unpleasant choice in the Black Sea
Description: Such a well-founded assumption was made by the spokesman of the Navy of Ukraine, Captain 3rd rank Dmytro Pletenchuk, . - This may indicate the fact that at some point the Russians felt uneasy at their base of Novorossian and had to choose, as they say in Russia, -from fire to flame,- he said. The occupiers had little choice - either to stay at the base, where they could be hit by Ukrainian long-range weapons, or to go out to sea, where Ukrainian naval drones stalk enemy ships. — As a result, they chose to go out to sea, where they can meet Ukrainian drones. Why did they make this choice? We'll probably find out sometime soon. But most likely, their choice was not very pleasant, the spokesman suggested. Obviously, it became even more dangerous for the occupier ships to stay at the base in Novorossiysk than to go to the open sea. - The tactic of hiding at the Novorossiysk base for the past many months is understandable, because it is easier to organize defense there than in the open sea. Therefore, such a choice leads to similar conclusions, Dmytro Pletenchuk noted. On the other hand, he emphasized, it is hardly possible to claim that going to sea is connected with the possible use of ship-based missile weapons by the Russians. Earlier, ArmyInform explained, what could threaten the mass withdrawal of Russian missile carriers to the Black Sea, and reported that due to logistical problems, the occupiers will increase the transport load on the emergency Crimean Bridge.

Title: A moment of silence in Ukraine
Description: -In order to honor the bright memory, civic courage and self-sacrifice, strength of spirit, resilience and heroic deed of the soldiers who fell during the execution of combat missions to protect the state sovereignty and territorial integrity of Ukraine, civilians who died as a result of the armed aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine , I decree: to start holding a nationwide minute of silence every day at 9:00 a.m. for compatriots who died as a result of the armed aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine, to be announced in all mass media regardless of the form of ownership,- the document says.

From 20:00 on 15.09 to 06:00 on 16.09, the radio engineering troops of the Air Force detected and escorted 56 attack UAVs (launches from Kursk and Yeisk - Russian Federation). Title: The occupiers tried to advance in the districts of Kostyantynivka and Georgiivka — the General Staff...
Description: This is reported in the operational information of the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine as of 08 :00 September 16. Yesterday, the enemy launched a missile strike against the positions of Ukrainian units and populated areas with the use of one missile, as well as 77 airstrikes, including dropping 117 anti-aircraft missiles. In addition, he carried out 3,888 attacks, 114 of them from rocket salvo fire systems. Title: Mobilized in Britain: -cloak-coat- and -dragon fire- on -forest exercises- Interflex
Description: We are camping near the lake. In the morning, fog hangs and swirls on the surface of the water. Today is the last day of the -forest- trip, and we are finally lucky - for the first time in three days, the rain subsided, and then the rain stopped. As soon as the sun rises over our -Sherwood- forest, thick steam rises from the ground, grass, trees and wet clothing. The rays burn as mercilessly as the cold rain poured down before it. Such is the climate and weather of the British Isles in the middle of the sea. For the next lesson, instructors gather at our branch on the lake shore. We wait for several minutes until the other departments come up - they are a little further, so they have to go longer. At this time, we are quizzed to find out how well we remembered the content of yesterday's lessons. I catch myself thinking that it is easier to do the task correctly than to explain how and why exactly you do it. It's not a language barrier - our translators do an excellent job. The point is in the nature of the memorization itself - it happened at the bodily level of muscle memory, so in order to realize it, it is necessary to first reproduce the sequence of actions. Some rush not to tell, but to show. Instructors do not deny that in battle you need to do, and not explain how you do it. Doing the task is better than talking about it, and the teachers are happy with the students, which is what they wanted. In the end, the whole platoon gathers on the shore and we are shown the content of the next lesson. The instructors remind once again that a good soldier must always take care of himself. Good health and physical fitness, sufficient sleep and rest, adequate nutrition and comfortable living conditions determine the combat effectiveness of personnel, and therefore the effectiveness of combat missions. The instructors note that in the rain we all got soaked. In addition, they explain, during the hostilities we will have to overcome water obstacles one way or another, which is why we were gathered on the shore of the lake. So now there will be hands-on training with elements of immersion in reality and we will be taught how to dry quickly even if we get wet even worse than we already got wet in the rain. The hint becomes more than transparent - we guess that now at least part of the lake will have to be waded along the shore. -Hell, I think, why get up an hour before the official climb and dry my uniform - I'd rather sleep.- The next thought is about where the children's clock goes - I have an ordinary office clock and in the rain it has already fogged up from the inside from excessive moisture, although the hands are still moving. Diving would leave him no chance of survival. The intrigue is intensifying, but we still haven't received an order to swim across the lake or even enter it. Realizing exactly what we are afraid of, the instructors look at each other conspiratorially and smile. I watch how the second hand crawls behind the fogged glass, and I decide to drown the watch for good. The house, the mountains and the barn burned down - we had to buy a waterproof one. I don't want to get into the water in a dry form, but I'm already mentally ready for that. Everything is resolved unexpectedly - another one of the instructors just swims up to us from the depths of the lake. For at least 20 minutes, he watched us from the cold water near the shore. Now, using his own example, he will show us how to quickly dry thoroughly soaked clothes and shoes. We will dry our already wet uniforms - there is no need to get into the lake for this. The technology of self-drying is simple - we have already described it and shown it a little earlier. In about the same way, I dried myself before waking up. However, the instructors now show and describe important details that we might not have paid enough attention to. The basic things you need for drying are a fire source and dry fuel, ours is FireDragon - -dragon fire- or -dragon fire- as you prefer. It is desirable to also have some kind of stand on which you can place a mini-fireplace, but in extreme cases, an ordinary stone or a fragment of a brick will also do. The most interesting element is the -cloak-coat-, which we just called - a poncho, a tent, a cape, and a cover. The variety of names is due to the versatility and multi-functionality of this rectangular sheet. With the help of a -cloak-coat-, you can arrange the simplest shelter - a mini-tent or a cover. You can simply cover your gear and supplies with it, or wrap yourself in it. A camouflage-colored waterproof -cloak-coat- is necessary so that no one notices you during a stop. It is able to protect both from a heavy downpour and from the scorching rays of the sun. And during drying, the -cloak-coat- helps to create a special microenvironment around the fighter dressed in thoroughly soaked clothes, in which the high temperature allows for rapid warming, and the intense evaporation - to expel moisture from the clothes. The main thing is to be careful not to burn the -cloak-coat- with -dragon fire-. But this is already a matter of vigilance and the minimum necessary skills. The instructor easily advises on this, as long as his colleague explains the best way to dry the shoes. Read also: The General Staff showed what equipment Ukrainians receive during training in Great Britain Finally, we they ask if we noticed the newcomer from the lake before they invited him out. We did not notice - under some branches hanging from the shore and natural debris, the instructor was extremely well camouflaged. Careful local camouflage will be one of our next lessons. The Interflex Intensive continues with another action-packed day.

Title: Combat Boat 90: the expert talked about the advantages of combat boats that Ukraine will receive fro...
Description: The purpose, tactical properties and combat capabilities of the SV90, as well as the likely scenarios for the use of these boats, in particular in the Azov-Black Sea region, were told to the ArmyInform correspondent by the officer of the Navy of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, retired captain 1st rank, candidate of military sciences Stepan Yakymyak. It is known that these boats are the best in their class, as evidenced by their use by many countries, including the United States. It is no secret that the so-called -great maritime power- of the Russian Federation also at one time purchased several samples of such boats from a Swedish manufacturing company and built one and a half dozen such boats. Swedish SV90 combat boats were produced in different versions and for various tasks, but during their design and creation, the main task was the rapid deployment and landing of amphibious assault groups on the coast. This is evidenced by the special bow gear, the ability to transport a relatively large number of people in a special protected room and the small draft of the boat (0.8 m), which allows a direct approach to the shore. According to Stepan Yakymyak, these boats are primarily capable of quickly and safely delivering personnel over considerable distances and covertly evacuating them. — For example, in the conditions of hostilities on rivers 2 km wide, a group of six such boats can transfer a company of paratroopers in full equipment from one bank to another within 1.5-2 minutes. In sea areas, this unit can be overturned by the same group of boats over a distance of more than 400 km in about ten hours with the mandatory condition of providing combat support for this group and support, primarily from air strikes, Stepan Yakymyak noted. Other advantages include increased maneuverability and the ability to approach directly to different types of coasts (rocky, sandy, marshy, etc.). — In addition to amphibious, assault, and special operations, combat boats of the SV90 type, if used by the Defense Forces of Ukraine, can be used to lay mines, to perform patrolling tasks, transport troops and property, and evacuate the wounded. Also, these boats can perform tasks in the protection of sea and river communications and in combat support of forces operating in river and sea areas and on the coast. In the case of operations along the sea coast and ensuring greater stealth of operations, the task of transferring several special-purpose groups to the coast controlled by the enemy can be successfully accomplished. When using such boats, it is necessary to carefully plan reconnaissance, surveillance and cover them from the air against the strikes of UAVs and enemy fighter-bomber aircraft. So, the range of tasks, taking into account the actual areas of operation of the Defense Forces of Ukraine on rivers, estuaries and the Black Sea, is actually very wide. However, as Stepan Yakymyak adds, a much larger number of such boats is needed, which is due to the scale and scope of the areas of military operations and the combat capabilities of the enemy. If their number is sufficient, they could perform up to 40-60% of the main combat tasks of the surface forces of the Navy of the Armed Forces of Ukraine at sea and rivers. By the way, about the options for the use of these boats told the spokesman of the Navy, captain of the third rank, Dmytro Pletenchuk.

Title: Stolen icons, hanged children and a shot train: fakes about Kurshchyna, with which the Kremlin scare...
Description: In August, screenshots of ads allegedly posted on the OLX service appeared on z-channels. They depict Orthodox icons that were allegedly taken by the Ukrainian military from the Kursk region. The most common selection published by Telegram scammers includes five allegedly stolen icons. >Estonian resource provereno.media found the originals of these images. As it turned out, the icons come from Konotop, Zaporizhzhia, Kyiv, Kremenchuk and Lviv Oblast. One technical detail unites all the fake images: the top line shows the location — Kursk Oblast and Kursk. But everyone who uses the Ukrainian OLX service knows that only Ukrainian regions can be selected there. Kyiv and Kirovohrad regions, as well as Crimea (ARC) are represented on the site under the letter K. The purpose of spreading this fake is obvious — to accuse the Armed Forces of the Armed Forces of looting. ArmyInform already wrote about the -reflection- tactic, which Russian propagandists actively use when talking about Kurshchyna. This is how they try to accuse Ukraine of war crimes similar to those committed by the Russians in 2022 in Buch, Mariupol, Izyum and other Ukrainian cities and villages. Recently, propagandists have been terrorizing their citizens with particularly brutal -units of the Armed Forces of Ukraine- , formed from Georgian, Polish, French and American mercenaries-, who -hanged 8 children in a barn-, or that -The command of the Armed Forces during the attack on the Kursk region ordered to shoot a passenger train.- In Ukraine and in the West, such lies no longer work, because many representatives of foreign, influential and truly independent media have already visited the occupied Armed Forces territory of the Kursk region. In their reports, foreign media persons claim that they did not see traces of -atrocities- similar to Russian prisoners, as well as to civilians — that is why Moscow is so nervous about uncontrolled mass media in a territory it does not control. In addition, it was the Kremlin that refused to provide a humanitarian corridor for the evacuation of civilians from the territory of Kurshchyna, which is controlled by the Armed Forces of Ukraine. That's why many questions about Putin and his managerial vertical arise already in Russia itself. After all, the Kremlin dictator uses Russian citizens in the war only as consumables.

Title: Volodymyr Zelenskyy told the details of Ukraine's victory plan
Description: The head of state told about this in interview CNN. -I will personally speak with Joe Biden before the Peace Summit about how to strengthen us so that we are in a strong position. Because diplomatic solutions are good if you are strong. Otherwise, Putin will not even participate in this. And I think that under other circumstances they would not be interested in stopping the war,- Volodymyr Zelenskyy said. The President noted that victory for Ukraine means being very strong and being ready for strong diplomacy. -And that is why I have prepared several points. Four of them are the main points. Plus one that we need after the war. I will share them with President Biden. It is about security, geopolitical location of Ukraine, very strong military support of Ukraine. And about the fact that we should freely decide how to use this or that thing. We are talking about decisions on economic support,- Volodymyr Zelenskyy said. He added that he is ready to accept proposals for this plan from Joe Biden's team if they strengthen the peace plan and Ukraine's position. -I think it will be fair and proper to share this plan with both candidates for the presidency of the United States - Kamala Harris and Donald Trump. And a lot also depends on the decisions of the US Congress, so we would like to share with Congress as well. After these steps, we are ready to share the plan with everyone,- said the President of Ukraine. Earlier, Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that Ukraine is asking the United States to grant permission to use long-range weapons to attack Russian airfields, but not received it yet.

Title: Vovchansk is under fire control: the occupiers are hiding in the woods
Description: A military man with the call sign -Stig- told about this on the air of the national telethon -Edyny Novyny- - officer of the 2nd separate detachment of the Special Purpose Center -OMEGA- of the National Guard of Ukraine. — The city is almost completely destroyed, there is not a single whole building. We are right now in the suburbs of Vovchansk, so I can confidently tell you that there is not a single whole building in the city, he said. The degree of destruction of Vovchansk is catastrophic - the battles are taking place right in the urban development. — The city is completely under fire control both from the enemy's side and from our side. Right now, an artillery duel is going on, the city is being covered by enemy artillery, our artillery is working, our strike drones are working, the military said. The occupiers do not stop trying to advance and gain a foothold in the city ruins. — The enemy is trying to advance with reconnaissance groups, small infantry groups to some new positions. However, it faces resistance from the Security and Defense Forces and loses its offensive potential. But he will not stop trying to move forward through the city, the officer said. At the same time, the occupiers cannot set up positions in the city, so they mostly entrench themselves in the surrounding forests. - They try to hide mostly in the forests. Very good vegetation here, very good terrain from the point of view of shelters. Therefore, most of them hide in dense forests. -Unfortunately, this is a problem, because even in winter, if it is a coniferous forest, it is very difficult to recognize and hit the enemy,- explained the Ukrainian drone commander. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that in Vovchansk, the occupiers are resorting to single infiltration tactics , and fights in the city take place just inside high-rise buildings a>.

Title: Pointed Russian missiles at Kharkiv: the enemy informant was sentenced
Description: The sentence became known from the sentence of the court register, the identity of the convicted installed Kharkiv Anti-Corruption Center (KHAC). According to the HAC, it is about Yuriy Panfilov, who was accused of disseminating information about the deployment of the Armed Forces and justifying Russian aggression. The court recognized the man as an informant of the Russian special services, who adjusted Russian airstrikes against the critical infrastructure of Kharkiv. Among the main targets of the enemy were strategically important enterprises, in particular the defense-industrial complex. For greater effectiveness of missile and drone attacks, the Russians expected to receive from Panfilov the geolocation of Ukrainian air defense. In case of receiving such information, the invaders hoped to -bypass- the air defense systems of the Armed Forces of Ukraine or carry out a targeted attack on them. To collect intelligence, the convict found the places of -arrivals-, and then took hidden photos and videos there. The man forwarded all the information he received to several chat rooms of pro-Kremlin Telegram channels controlled by the special services of the aggressor country. Also, in September 2023, he videotaped the consequences of the Russian shelling of the state-owned enterprise Kharkiv Armored Plant. The convict began transmitting data to the enemy in the fall of 2023. Before that, Panfilov distinguished himself by publishing posts and comments on Facebook in which he tried to discredit Ukrainian defenders and admired the aggressor state. In addition, he denied that residential buildings in Kharkiv were being shelled by the aggressor state, and he called the tragedy in Buch, which was staged by the Russian military, a theater and a fake. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that law enforcement officers reported the suspicion to the Russian general, who ordered the capture of -Kharkiv in 5 days-.

Title: The General Staff of the Armed Forces: the enemy concentrated its efforts in three directions

At the same time, in the afternoon, enemy aviation from the territory of the Russian Federation struck the civilian infrastructure of the city of Kharkiv with guided aerial bombs. On the Kupyansk direction the enemy stormed the positions of our units 14 times in the area of ​​Synkivka, Petropavlivka, Kolisnikivka, Hlushkivka, Kruglyakivka, and Lozova. Five clashes are still ongoing. Ukrainian soldiers continue to maintain their defense. In the Lymansky direction, during the day, the invading army carried out 16 attacks on Ukrainian positions near Druzhelyubivka, Kovalivka, Tverdokhlibovo, Nevsky, Makiivka, Terny, and Novosadovo. Eleven hostilities have ended, two more are ongoing. Enemy aircraft actively operated in the areas of Serebryansky Forest, Tverdokhlibovo and Dronivka. The occupying troops continue to look for weak points in our defense on the Seversk direction. Near the settlements of Bilogorivka, Verkhnyokamianske, Vyimka and Ivano-Daryivka. The defenders of the Ukrainian land repelled six enemy attacks. Two more clashes are ongoing. The settlements of Siversk, Mykolaivka and Pereizne were hit by enemy air defense systems. In the Kramatorsk direction units of the Defense Forces repelled an attack by Russian invaders near Stupochy. At the same time, the enemy's army aviation fired twice at Chasiv Yar with unguided air missiles. In the Toretsk direction, 11 enemy attacks took place in the area of ​​Toretsk, Dachny, Shcherbinivka and Nelipivka. Ukrainian soldiers repelled eight enemy attacks, three more battles continue. The aggressor mainly concentrates his efforts in the Toretsk area, actively using assault and army aviation. In the Pokrovsky direction since the beginning of the day, the occupiers have made 16 attempts to dislodge our defenders from their occupied positions in the areas of Vozdvizhenka, Zeleny Pol, Novotoretsk, Grodivka, Novogrodivka, and Marynivka. Defense forces are holding back the onslaught and repulsed 13 attacks, with three clashes still ongoing. In the Kurakhiv direction, the invaders attacked 22 times in the direction of Zhelanny Drugo, Ukranian, Selidovy, Dolynivka, Georgiivka, Katerynivka, and Kostyantynivka. Fifteen attempts by the occupiers to advance have already been repulsed. In the Vremivsk direction there were six enemy attacks near Vodyanyi, Katerynivka and Makarivka. Three battles are not over yet. On the Orihiv direction, the occupation troops unsuccessfully attacked near Novodarivka. Four times the enemy stormed the positions of our defenders in the Dnieper direction. Two clashes are still ongoing.

Title: The head of the IOU GUR considers Russia's statements about a new escalation to be myths
Description: This was stated by the head of the Main Directorate of Intelligence of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine, Lieutenant General Kyrylo Budanov, during a panel discussion at the annual meeting of the Yalta European Strategy (YES) in Kyiv, ArmiyaInform reports. -I have been hearing all these myths about escalation since 2014. What is escalation when we are fighting a fully conventional, all-out war? Absolutely all types of weapons that exist in the world have already been used. Well, how else can the situation be escalated?- said the head of the Ministry of Internal Affairs and Communications of the Ministry of Internal Affairs. Kyrylo Budanov rejected the seriousness of the suggestion that the president of the Russian Federation would provide much more aid to countries and groups in the Middle East with the aim of escalating the war there. -How can he help when he himself asks for help from others? How will it help globally? Yes, you can send a special forces unit, no problem. You can transfer, for example, 50 MANPADS. But what next? Everything is fighting here, the entire Russian army, everything that is produced goes directly from the assembly line to the front. Everything they buy - by the way, no one gives them anything for free - everything goes to the front. How will they help?-, the head of the GUR of the Ministry of Defense argued his position. -Globally, they cannot do anything as long as the war in Ukraine continues,- Kyrylo Budanov concluded. As reported by ArmyInform, from the summer of 2025 in Russia serious problems will begin in the economy and there will be a need for mobilization, which can undermine the socio-political situation in the aggressor country.

According to him, the Russian Federation is currently struggling with the deterioration of the economic situation, because it understands that the recession, which is already noticeable and painful, continues. According to the head of the Main Directorate of Intelligence of the Ministry of Defense, the issue of shortage of personnel in the army is becoming more and more acute in Russia. -During this period (in the summer of next year 2025, - ed.) they will face a dilemma: either to announce mobilization, or somehow it is necessary to reduce the intensity of hostilities a little bit, which may ultimately be critical for them,- the Ukrainian leader said military intelligence. Kyrylo Budanov believes that -war fatigue exists in Russia, no matter what anyone says, because the war has already affected a large section of the Russian population.- He said that the Russians are frankly happy that the aggressor has already managed to capture more than 30% of the territory of our country, and they are also satisfied with the high salary in the Russian army. However, the number of volunteers is decreasing, which has prompted an increase in one-time payments upon signing a contract to 2 million rubles (equivalent to $21,993). The head of the GUR of the Ministry of Defense added that the socio-psychological state of the population of the aggressor country was also affected by Ukraine's efforts to transfer hostilities to the territory of Russia, deep into it. Title: After the strikes of the Armed Forces of Ukraine on objects deep in Russia, for the population of th...
Description: This was stated by the head of the Main Directorate of Intelligence of the Ministry of Defense during a panel discussion within the XX meeting of the Yalta European Strategy (YES). The presenter asked the head of the IOU GUR how he assesses the possibilities of Ukraine to transfer the war to the territory of Russia. Kyrylo Budanov replied that, as a citizen, he would like more. However, -you have to look at things realistically-, so the head of military intelligence would focus on long-range strikes against the enemy. -Ukraine was a little weaker, that must also be recognized. And it's the fact that it's been almost three years of full-scale, and ten years of our war in general, and we're still holding on,- he said. The head of the GUR MOU noted that at the beginning of the Russian Federation's large-scale aggression against Ukraine, -we were definitely dealing with one of the most powerful armies in the world,- and the Russians failed to break us. -This is despite the fact that Russia has a large stockpile of weapons and equipment accumulated during independence, inherited from the times of the USSR and received from other states, such as the DPRK. Our ability to transfer hostilities to the territory of Russia — here I would place more emphasis on the ability to strike deep into the territory of the Russian Federation. This is the first. And on the very philosophy of it. It changed the outlook a little,- said the head of the GUR MOU. Kyrylo Budanov drew attention to the fact that the myth of their invincibility and security was destroyed for the population of the aggressor country after the strikes of the Armed Forces of Ukraine on objects deep in Russia. This greatly affected their social and psychological condition. He noted that previously Russians were convinced that their country was one of the strongest in the world, but this myth was destroyed with the first explosions in Moscow. As the head of the Ministry of Internal Affairs and Communications noted, -he undermined the entire foundation.- Kyrylo Budanov believes that this is the main achievement of these long-range strikes - breaking the faith of the people that they live in safety. When asked by the moderator of the discussion whether more such strikes are needed, the head of military intelligence of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine answered that -while the war is going on, everything must be done to the maximum. And when you can do more, you have to do more.- As reported by ArmiyaInform, on September 11, 2024, Nobody, Chimera, Aratta, Raven Group units and the 2nd special operations unit named after Vladyslav Peleshenko of the GUR of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine with the support of -Group 13- and the 10th mobile border unit -Dozor- of the State Border Service of Ukraine They carried out raid near the coast of Crimea.

Title: The US Army intends to conduct another test of hypersonic weapons by the end of 2024
Description: According to information profile resource Defense News, the head of the procurement department of the US Army, Doug Bush, made a corresponding statement. ArmyInform reports. Common Hypersonic Glide Body (C-HGB, -Common Hypersonic Glide Body-), which is a universal projectile developed jointly with the US Navy, was successfully tested at the beginning of 2024. The Navy envisions using the munition to be launched from ship-based launchers, while the US Army plans to integrate the munition for a land-based launch station. Defense News reports that the US Army has long worked with Leidos' Dynetics with the goal of creating an industrial base for the Common Hypersonic Glide Body, which will enter the armament of both the ground forces and the Navy. Previously, American private business had never been involved in the development of hypersonic weapons. -Following the Navy tests, we need to make sure that we have a full end-to-end test as close as possible to an operational test that will be successful,- Bush told reporters at a Pentagon briefing. The official also added that it is necessary to have confidence that weapons can be safely transferred to a unit that -may have to go to war.- The Army has yet to conduct fully successful trials. But, as Bush said, the military hopes that such a test will take place this year. If the tests are successful, the service will be able to transfer the hypersonic unit to the first unit as an initial operational capability as early as next year. Hypersonic missiles are capable of reaching a speed of Mach 5 (about 6,000 km per hour). The glider unit can maneuver at altitude, which makes detection by anti-missile systems difficult. According to the Pentagon, the battery of the ground complex consists of a command and staff vehicle and four heavy transporters with two containers on each with hypersonic missiles. The project range of the missile is 2775 km. The first US Army unit to receive hypersonic weapons (with the exception of universal munitions) was the 5th Battalion, 3rd Regiment, 17th Field Artillery Brigade at Joint Base Lewis-McChord (Washington State). The unit is part of the 1st multidisciplinary task force. The delivery took place two days before the scheduled commissioning date at the end of the 2021 fiscal year. The C-HGB consists of a warhead, a guidance system, cables and a protective heat shield. In August, Lt. Gen. Robert Rush, director of the Rapid Capabilities and Critical Technologies Office, said the Army was -really close- to deploying hypersonic weapons. But he cautioned that more tests would need to be conducted before any decision could be made about the future of the ground-based hypersonic missile. In May 2024, the US Navy conducted flight tests of an industrially produced missile in Hawaii. The tests were highly anticipated after a series of failed or aborted Common Hypersonic Glide Body tests. In 2023, the army and navy had to interrupt flight tests three times due to problems with the preparation of the missile for launch. As General Rush pointed out, it usually takes about ten years to develop missiles, but the hypersonic weapons program took only five years. According to him, it is necessary to make sure that -everything works-. If a decision is made to introduce a new weapon, there are strong strategic reasons for this. Video: Testing of a hypersonic weapon prototype by the Pentagon. Video: USNI News Video

A residential building was destroyed, neighboring houses and shop premises were damaged. Also in Izyum Oblast, the occupiers shelled the villages of Shykivka and Horokhovatka of the Boriv community. As a result of the shelling, there were fires in the ecosystems, the house was on fire. Information about the victims was not received. In the Kupyan district, the Russian invaders attacked the villages of the Kuril community. In the village of Glushkivka, as a result of the shelling (previously KAB), meadows and a cafe were on fire, and three residential buildings were also damaged. In the village of Novoosynove, 2 farm buildings and a truck were on fire as a result of shelling (previously RSZV). In the village of Podoli, three outbuildings burned down as a result of shelling. Photos of the destruction caused by shelling of these settlements were published in DSNS of Ukraine and Head Office of the State Emergency Service of Ukraine in the Kharkiv Region. The rescuers reported that in Novoosynovo, two farm buildings and a car on an area of ​​200 m² were on fire, and in Podoliy - three buildings and a summer kitchen, and 5 hectares of dry land also caught fire. Title: Under the condition of attracting investments, the potential of defense production of Ukraine can re...
Description: About this he said during a panel discussion at the Yalta European Strategy forum. Rustem Umyerov noted that Ukraine is able to significantly increase the production of military equipment and weapons, but for this, the support of foreign investors is needed. According to the Minister of Defense of Ukraine, the key needs of Ukraine remain timely financial and military assistance. -Last year we planned our production capabilities and determined how much we could jointly produce in the private and public sectors. Then our potential was 7 billion dollars. In 2025, we can triple this indicator,- said Rustem Umyerov. According to IOU estimates, under the conditions of additional financing, the potential of defense production can reach 20 billion dollars. -We are ready to open joint ventures with you. We can introduce you and connect you with any of our leaders to work together. This will give us the opportunity to increase our capabilities as well,- the Minister of Defense emphasized. He also emphasized that the capabilities of Ukraine's defense industry significantly exceed the amount of investments that the country can provide on its own. -Ukraine has already gained recognition in the world thanks to its courage. However, we have also excelled at being creative in difficult circumstances. The Ministry of Defense is ready to open joint ventures with partners. This will allow us to significantly increase our production capacity,- added Rustem Umyerov. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that the Minister of Defense of Ukraine Rustem Umyerov took part in the European Defense Roundtable organized by the Munich Security Conference, and discussed with representatives of allied countries ways to counter the Russian threat.

Title: -Double blow-: on the army and the economy. Expert on the consequences of damage to enemy refineries
Description: What is the effect of these attacks, how will it affect Russia's economy and its ability to continue to maintain the Russian Army's combat capability to wage a war of aggression against Ukraine? Military expert Petro Chernyk told ArmyInform about this: -We will divide this issue (strikes on the oil industry of the Russian Federation - ed.) into two parts. The first is the political and ideological part, and the second is purely technical and economic. In the political part, the myth that it is impossible to strike on the territory of Russia is finally dispelled. That is, a nuclear state cannot be struck, because it is not known what will happen. There is already the experience of the successful Kursk operation, and we have been hitting their oil industry for a good year and no nuclear apocalypse has happened. So, it turns out that it is possible to inflict fire damage on a nuclear state. To be fair, this is not the only case in history, as there are some experts who say it never happened. But, as it turns out, a similar situation has already happened, in 1982 non-nuclear Argentina attacked nuclear Britain, and Britain did not respond with nuclear weapons. By the way, the same Soviet Union survived an attack from the Chinese on Damansky Island in 1969, and no disaster happened either. That is, this ideological factor that it is possible to carry out complex strikes on their territory not only for military purposes, but especially for oil purposes, is very important.- We understand that as long as Russia sells oil abroad, as long as it lives as a country. That is, 40% of their budget is formed exclusively thanks to revenues from the oil and gas sector. The more strikes there, the less they will sell oil to foreign markets and receive hard currency. In this context, it is important to note that the Iskander-M missile has 27 foreign-made parts in its configuration. The Kh-47 -Kinzhal- missile has 130 foreign-made parts. And their most massive reconnaissance drone -Orlan-10- is half-equipped with foreign-made parts. That is, the less currency the Russians have, the less they will be able to purchase the necessary parts from which weapons will be made. Plus, fuel itself, as such, is one of the key aspects in today's war between the Russian Federation and Ukraine. After all, this is a war of military equipment, primarily heavy. Let me remind you that a T-90 tank consumes up to one ton of fuel and up to 100 kilograms of lubricant per day. If the enemy has around three thousand tanks along the demarcation line, then the Russians need three thousand fuel, in particular diesel, per day. Plus, the most elementary thing that worries us at the moment is enemy aviation. The same Su-34, Su-25, Su-24, Su-30 and so on. And plus enemy helicopters can also refuel with aviation kerosene. That is, to provide all this equipment, the occupiers need a lot of fuel resources. The most powerful blow that the Defense Forces of Ukraine inflicted was when an oil depot in the Rostov region of the Russian Federation burned for more than 9 days. There, first of all, tanks with aviation kerosene burned out. Of course, it is still a little early to say that the Ukrainian strikes will really affect their entire oil-refining sector of the Russian economy. After all, they have 30 large factories and 50 small ones, which is a lot. And in the area of ​​oil refining, Russians are definitely among the top three countries in the world. But the fact that this process (destruction or damage to enterprises of the oil and gas industry of the Russian Federation - ed.) is increasing and that each time they have fewer and fewer resources, for example, for oil processing, this is extremely important today. I will give an interesting example. If today there is a question of buying microelectronics, it can, of course, be bought on world markets in such a way that no one will understand who is buying it. Because it can be implemented, relatively speaking, through 5-10 procurement chains. Let's take a company from Iran. It ordered the necessary microelectronics from somewhere, say, Mexico, and the documents show that it is for household appliances. Then it (microelectronics - ed.) was taken and bought from the Americans and it got back to Iran. Who will control them? This is impossible to do. However, if a company in Paraguay were to come to Denmark, France, Germany and say -sell us the oil equipment- that has now burned down in Russia, it will become obvious to everyone who is the ultimate beneficiary and who is the ultimate buyer. Therefore, Russians will no longer be able to buy the necessary equipment on these global markets. And they cannot produce them themselves, especially atmospheric-vacuum pipes, where the distillation of oil and corresponding oil products takes place. Therefore, this (hitting Russian oil and gas industry enterprises - ed.) is simply a fantastic, wonderful, asymmetric response to our enemy. It (the answer - ed.) should grow and it will eventually give results. My favorite historical parallel. Hitler's Germany really fell when the Americans and the British destroyed 12 German plants for the production of synthetic gasoline. That's when things got bad for the Germans. Sooner or later, things will get bad for the Russians too.

Title: Church Laundry Lies: Enemy Propaganda Does Not Fear God
Description: Recently, fake information began to spread in social networks and on various pro-Kremlin Telegram channels that a laundry was allegedly opened in Lutsk in a church selected by the MP. As -evidence-, a photo of the church is attached, at the entrance of which the inscription -Clean - and Laundry- can be seen. StopFake investigators discovered that this is a photo of the bell tower of the Greek-Catholic Church of the Sending of the Holy Spirit in the city of Terebovlia, in the Ternopil region. A social laundry was opened there last year. According to notification of the Terebovlia City Council, the Greek Catholic parish was the winner of the mini-grant within the framework of the project -Development of social services for community cohesion to support IDPs and vulnerable groups at the parish level-. Parishioners monitored the situation in the community, drew up a map of needs and identified vulnerable categories of the population. They came to the conclusion that there is a need for a social laundry in Terebovla. After all, there are many seriously ill people in the community who need such a service and cannot take their clothes to Ternopil or Chortkiv. That is why they decided to implement such a social initiative. But the Russian agitprop decided to use this initiative to create another fake about the alleged -oppression- of the Moscow Patriarchate of the Ukrainian Orthodox Church and the -religious apocalypse- in Ukraine.

Title: What is known about one of the first F-16 pilots: the story of the fallen officer Oleksiy Mesia
Description: … The year is 2022. ZSU pilots Oleksiy Mes and Andriy Pilshchikov meet with American government officials to convince them: the Ukrainian army needs fighter jets. To strengthen the position of the pilots, they were then joined by Hollywood actor Sean Penn. … 2024 year. Already on board the F-16 in the sky of Ukraine, Oleksiy Mes repels a massive Russian combined air and missile strike. He destroyed three cruise missiles and one attack UAV — saving Ukrainians from enemy weapons. But, unfortunately, at the cost of his own life. What kind of officer was Mes and how he helped our state to become stronger and more effective in beating the enemy - in the ArmyInform material. Born on October 20, 1993 in Shepetivka, Khmelnytskyi. There he studied at a local school, which he graduated with a gold medal. Subsequently, he studied at the Kharkiv National University of the Air Force named after Ivan Kozhedub. Graduated from university in 2016. It is interesting that Mes and Andriy Pilshchikov with the call sign -Jus- were peers and studied together at KhNUPS. And died with a difference of 1 year and 1 day. -This is our issue, of which the whole of Ukraine and the Air Force are proud. I was lucky to be the instructor who gave him a ticket to the sky on the MiG-29 aircraft,- said Brigadier General Serhiy Golubtsov, Chief of Aviation of the Air Force Command of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, at Oleksiy's farewell. Back in 2014, Mes went to Norway - at that time he was studying in the fourth year of KhNUPS. Told partners about participation in the OOS, exchanged experience, etc. And then there is the military service under the contract. He was enrolled in the personnel of the military unit in the position of squadron support commander - deputy commander of the operational group. In September 2022, the pilot was awarded the medal -For military service to Ukraine- - for personal courage and selfless actions shown in the defense of the state sovereignty and territorial integrity of Ukraine, loyalty to the military oath. The nickname -Moonfish- (-Fish-moon-) Mes got because of one of the curious cases, about which the man chose not to tell. As of June 2022, Mes was the commander of a squadron of Ukrainian MiG-29 fighters. At the age of 29, he had the rank of lieutenant colonel. Mes lobbied for the transfer of F-16 fighters to Ukraine. Pilots traveled to the United States, talked with the media and officials. He was fluent in English and could equally argue the need to protect the sky. -Moonfish- became the real face of Ukraine's F-16 lobbying campaign. Yes, back in June 2022, Ukrainian pilots flew to Washington to meet with members of the US Congress. There they spoke with Senator Mark Kelly, a former pilot and astronaut. After all, Moonfish was one of the first eight Ukrainian pilots to learn to fly the F-16 in Denmark in the fall of 2023. In September 2023, the Armed Forces wrote that an officer with the call sign -Moonfish- was undergoing F-16 training in Great Britain. He is one of those pilots called media. And after Juice and Moonfish met in Washington with Republican Congressman Adam Kinzinger, he introduced the Ukraine Fighter Pilots Act to the US House of Representatives. Moonfish was also one of the first Ukrainian pilots who went to the United States to learn how to fly the F-16. In September 2023, his training moved from the simulator cockpit to a real F-16 aircraft. At one time, Mes told about the training of Ukrainians on Western fighter jets on the air of a national telethon: -I would compare our planes that we have in our arsenal with the F-16 - it's like switching from a push-button phone to a 16th iPhone.- On August 26, 2024, the Russians launched another massive air-missile strike. Pilot Mesy on board the F-16 managed to destroy three cruise missiles and one attack UAV. -Aleksii saved Ukrainians from deadly Russian missiles. Unfortunately, at the cost of his own life. Oleksiy Mes was a strong and devoted soldier, a high-class pilot, a leader on earth and in the sky, a good friend, a loving son, father, husband, patriot of his country,- said the message of the Air Force Command of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. The soldier was buried on August 29. During the farewell ceremony, a pair of MiG-29 fighter jets paid tribute to the fallen pilot - Mesia's native MiGs, on which he began his pilot career. The pilot is survived by his wife Yulia, daughter, mother, father, sister. -His name was Oleksiy Mes, and he was the best pilot in Ukraine. He managed the entire F-16 project, he actually replaced the functional air attaché, he was a very funny guy and he loved his daughter very much. He was an excellent student who wanted to be a nuclear physicist and defended a research paper at the National Academy of Sciences about some incredible technology in dentistry,- recalls the officer, public activist Melania Podolyak. By order of the Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, lieutenant colonel Oleksiy Mesy was posthumously awarded the military rank of colonel.
